learning_objectives.objective: State the functions of various parts of the human body (e.g. eyes to see, teeth to chew food, spine to support the body)
Be aware of the methods to protect various parts of the body (e.g. methods for protecting the eyes and teeth, proper standing and sitting postures)
Give some examples of healthy living habits (e.g. having a balanced diet, exercising regularly, getting enough sleep, maintaining a relaxed and happy mood)

mcq.question: What do we use our eyes for? 我們的眼睛有什麼用途?

themes.topic_name: Difference between living things and non-living things

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware of the types of food commonly found in a balanced diet

themes.topic_name: Diversity and classification of living things

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that animals are classified into vertebrates and invertebrates

Classify animals according to their characteristics
Be aware that plants are classified into flowering plants and non-flowering plants

options.label: C
options.text: Feed milk to their young 用乳汁哺育幼崽

options.text: To pump blood 泵送血液

options.text: To digest food 消化食物

options.text: To pump blood 泵送血液

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that living things go through the life cycle of birth, growth, reproduction and death

mcq.question: What is the first stage in the life cycle of a frog? 青蛙生命週期的第一階段是什麼?
Which animal does NOT go through metamorphosis? 哪種動物不經歷變態?
What is the correct order of a butterfly's life cycle? 蝴蝶生命週期的正確順序是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Egg → Larva → Pupa → Adult 卵 → 幼蟲 → 蛹 → 成蟲

options.label: B
options.text: Egg → Pupa → Larva → Adult 卵 → 蛹 → 幼蟲 → 成蟲

options.label: C
options.text: Larva → Egg → Pupa → Adult 幼蟲 → 卵 → 蛹 → 成蟲

options.label: D
options.text: Adult → Egg → Larva → Pupa 成蟲 → 卵 → 幼蟲 → 蛹

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It makes us happy 這讓我們快樂

options.label: C
options.text: We can eat them 我們可以吃它們

options.label: D
options.text: They look pretty 它們看起來很漂亮

open_ended.question: Describe the life cycle of a butterfly in your own words. 用自己的話描述蝴蝶的生命週期。
How can you show respect and care for living things around you? 你如何表現出對周圍生命的尊重和關愛?
What are the similarities between the life cycles of a frog and a butterfly? 青蛙和蝴蝶的生命週期有什麼相似之處?

true_false.statement: All living things go through the same life cycle stages. 所有生物都經歷相同的生命週期階段。
A seed grows into a plant through germination. 種子通過發芽長成植物。
Dogs give birth to tadpoles. 狗生下蝌蚪。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the reproductive processes of live-bearing and egg-laying animals

mcq.question: Which of the following animals is a live-bearing animal? 以下哪種動物是胎生動物?
Which of the following animals is an egg-laying animal? 以下哪種動物是卵生動物?

options.label: A
options.text: By laying eggs 通過產卵

options.label: B
options.text: By giving birth to live babies 通過生下活的幼崽

options.text: By splitting into two 通過分裂成兩個

options.label: D
options.text: By growing from seeds 通過從種子生長

options.text: Live-bearing animals give birth to live babies, egg-laying animals lay eggs 胎生動物生下活的幼崽，卵生動物產卵

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Because their babies develop inside the mother's body 因為它們的幼崽在母體內發育

options.label: C
options.text: Because they don't like eggs 因為它們不喜歡蛋

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are mammals 因為它們是哺乳動物

open_ended.question: Name two live-bearing animals and two egg-laying animals. 列出兩種胎生動物和兩種卵生動物。

How do egg-laying animals protect their eggs? 卵生動物如何保護它們的卵?

true_false.statement: All mammals are live-bearing animals. 所有哺乳動物都是胎生動物。
Birds are egg-laying animals. 鳥類是卵生動物。
Frogs give birth to live babies. 青蛙生下活的幼崽。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that matter can be classified into solids, liquids and gases, and describe their properties (whether it has a fixed volume, whether it has a fixed shape)

mcq.question: Which state of matter has a fixed shape and volume? 哪種物質狀態具有固定的形狀和體積?

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

options.label: D
options.text: Cannot be compressed 不能被壓縮

mcq.question: Which of the following is a property of a gas? 以下哪項是氣體的性質?

options.label: C
options.text: Can be compressed 可以被壓縮

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise common communicable diseases (e.g. influenza, cholera) and their major causes and symptoms

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the reproductive process of flowering plants

Be aware that some plants can reproduce through roots, stems or leaves (e.g. radish and sweet potato can reproduce through roots, onion and garlic can reproduce through stems, Echeveria and Kalanchoe pinnata can reproduce through leaves)
Be aware that offspring produced by reproduction of animals and plants have similar characteristics to their parents

Identify characteristics that animals and plants inherited from their parents (e.g. skin colour, eye colour and shape of earlobe in humans; colour and number of petals) as well as those that are not inherited from their parents (e.g. hair length in humans)
Be aware that some human characteristics are inherited (e.g. ability to roll the tongue and bend the thumb backward) and cannot be changed through acquired learning

mcq.question: Which of the following can reproduce through roots? 以下哪一種可以通過根繁殖?
What is an inherited characteristic in plants? 以下哪一項是植物的遺傳特徵?

options.label: A
options.text: Number of petals 花瓣數量

options.label: B
options.text: Size of leaves 葉子大小

options.label: C
options.text: Damage from insects 昆蟲造成的損害

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of a human inherited trait? 以下哪一項是人類的遺傳特徵例子?

options.label: A
options.text: Ability to bend the thumb backward 拇指向後彎曲的能力

options.label: B
options.text: Learning to ride a bike 學習騎自行車

options.label: C
options.text: Speaking a language 說一種語言

mcq.question: Which part of a sweet potato is used for reproduction? 番薯的哪一部分用於繁殖?

open_ended.question: Name two plants that can reproduce through stems. 列出兩種可以通過莖繁殖的植物。
Give one example of a human characteristic that is inherited and one that is not. 舉出一個人類遺傳特徵的例子和一個非遺傳特徵的例子。
Explain why offspring of plants and animals have similar characteristics to their parents. 解釋為什麼動植物的後代與父母有相似的特徵。

true_false.statement: All plants reproduce only through flowers. 所有植物只能通過花繁殖。
The ability to roll the tongue is an inherited characteristic. 捲舌能力是一種遺傳特徵。
Hair length in humans is an inherited characteristic. 人類的頭髮長度是一種遺傳特徵。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the different ways living things increase the number of offspring and their chances of survival (e.g. plants produce a large number of seeds, mammals care for their young offspring)

mcq.question: Which of the following is a way plants increase their chances of survival? 以下哪一種是植物增加生存機會的方式？

options.label: A
options.text: Producing a large number of seeds 產生大量種子

options.label: D
options.text: Swimming in water 在水中游泳

mcq.question: How do mammals usually care for their young? 哺乳動物通常如何照顧幼崽？

options.label: A
options.text: By leaving them alone 讓牠們獨處

options.label: B
options.text: By feeding and protecting them 餵養和保護牠們

options.label: C
options.text: By producing many eggs 產下許多卵

mcq.question: What is the purpose of a plant producing many seeds? 植物產生大量種子的目的是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the chances of some seeds growing into new plants 增加一些種子長成新植物的機會

options.label: B
options.text: To attract insects 吸引昆蟲

options.label: C
options.text: To make the plant look pretty 讓植物看起來漂亮

options.label: D
options.text: To feed animals 餵養動物

mcq.question: Which animal lays eggs to reproduce? 哪種動物通過產卵繁殖？
Why do some animals care for their young? 為什麼有些動物會照顧幼崽？

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the survival rate of their offspring 提高後代的生存率

options.label: D
options.text: To scare other animals 嚇唬其他動物

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a way plants reproduce? 以下哪一種不是植物的繁殖方式？

options.label: B
options.text: Growing from cuttings 從插枝生長

mcq.question: What is a common way fish reproduce? 魚類常見的繁殖方式是什麼？

options.label: B
options.text: Giving birth to live young 直接生下幼崽

mcq.question: Which of the following animals does NOT care for its young? 以下哪種動物不會照顧幼崽？
How do flowering plants attract pollinators? 開花植物如何吸引傳粉者？

options.label: A
options.text: By producing bright colors and sweet smells 通過產生鮮豔的顏色和甜美的氣味

options.label: B
options.text: By making loud noises 發出大聲響

options.label: C
options.text: By hiding underground 躲在地下

mcq.question: What is the first stage in the life cycle of a butterfly? 蝴蝶生命週期的第一階段是什麼？

open_ended.question: Explain one way plants ensure their seeds can grow into new plants. 解釋一種植物確保種子能長成新植物的方式。
Why is it important for some animals to care for their young? Give an example. 為什麼有些動物照顧幼崽很重要？舉一個例子。
Describe the life cycle of a frog. 描述青蛙的生命週期。

true_false.statement: All plants reproduce by producing seeds. 所有植物都通過產生種子繁殖。
Mammals usually care for their young to increase their chances of survival. 哺乳動物通常會照顧幼崽以提高牠們的生存機會。
Fish always give birth to live young. 魚類總是直接生下幼崽。

themes.theme_name: Inter-relationship between Living Things and the Natural Environment
themes.topic_name: Biological forms and functions, and their adaptability to the environment

learning_objectives.objective: Give some examples of features of plants that help them adapt to their environment
Give some examples of features of animals that help them adapt to their environment
Recognise some behaviors of animals for surviving in their habitats (e.g. migration, hibernation)

mcq.question: Which of the following is a feature of cacti that helps them survive in the desert? 以下哪項是仙人掌幫助牠們在沙漠中生存的特徵?

options.label: A
options.text: Thick stems to store water 粗壯的莖來儲存水分

options.label: B
options.text: Large leaves to absorb sunlight 大葉子來吸收陽光

options.label: C
options.text: Bright flowers to attract insects 鮮豔的花朵來吸引昆蟲

options.label: D
options.text: Deep roots to reach underground water 深根來接觸地下水

mcq.question: How do polar bears adapt to the cold Arctic environment? 北極熊如何適應寒冷的北極環境?

options.label: A
options.text: Thick fur and fat layer 厚厚的皮毛和脂肪層

options.label: B
options.text: Light-colored skin to reflect sunlight 淺色皮膚來反射陽光

options.label: C
options.text: Long legs to run fast 長腿來快速奔跑

options.label: D
options.text: Sharp claws to climb trees 鋒利的爪子來爬樹

mcq.question: What is one way fish adapt to living in water? 魚類適應水中生活的一種方式是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Having gills to breathe underwater 有鰓可以在水下呼吸

options.label: B
options.text: Having lungs to breathe air 有肺可以呼吸空氣

options.label: C
options.text: Having wings to fly 有翅膀可以飛翔

options.label: D
options.text: Having fur to keep warm 有皮毛可以保暖

mcq.question: Which behavior helps some birds survive cold winters? 哪種行為幫助一些鳥類度過寒冷的冬天?

options.label: A
options.text: Migration to warmer places 遷徙到更溫暖的地方

options.label: B
options.text: Building nests underground 在地下築巢

options.label: C
options.text: Growing thicker feathers 長出更厚的羽毛

options.label: D
options.text: Eating more food 吃更多的食物

mcq.question: Why do some trees lose their leaves in winter? 為什麼有些樹在冬天會落葉?

options.label: A
options.text: To save water and energy 為了節省水分和能量

options.label: B
options.text: To attract more sunlight 為了吸引更多陽光

options.label: C
options.text: To grow new leaves faster 為了更快長出新葉子

options.label: D
options.text: To protect themselves from animals 為了保護自己免受動物侵害

mcq.question: How do camels adapt to the desert environment? 駱駝如何適應沙漠環境?

options.label: A
options.text: Storing fat in their humps 在駝峰中儲存脂肪

options.label: B
options.text: Having long tails to swat flies 有長尾巴來驅趕蒼蠅

options.label: C
options.text: Having sharp teeth to eat meat 有鋒利的牙齒來吃肉

options.label: D
options.text: Having webbed feet to swim 有蹼足來游泳

mcq.question: What is one feature of frogs that helps them live both in water and on land? 青蛙的一個特徵是什麼幫助牠們既能在水中又能在陸地上生活?

options.label: A
options.text: Moist skin for breathing 濕潤的皮膚用來呼吸

options.label: B
options.text: Hard shell for protection 硬殼用來保護

options.label: C
options.text: Wings for flying 翅膀用來飛翔

options.label: D
options.text: Long neck for reaching leaves 長脖子用來夠到葉子

mcq.question: Why do some animals hibernate in winter? 為什麼有些動物在冬天冬眠?

options.label: A
options.text: To survive when food is scarce 為了在食物短缺時生存

options.label: B
options.text: To avoid predators 為了躲避捕食者

options.label: C
options.text: To find a mate 為了尋找配偶

options.label: D
options.text: To grow bigger 為了長得更大

mcq.question: How do chameleons adapt to their environment? 變色龍如何適應環境?

options.label: A
options.text: Changing color to blend in 改變顏色以融入環境

options.label: B
options.text: Growing wings to fly 長出翅膀來飛翔

options.label: C
options.text: Producing venom to hunt 產生毒液來捕獵

options.label: D
options.text: Shedding skin frequently 頻繁蛻皮

mcq.question: What helps ducks swim in water? 什麼幫助鴨子在水中游泳?

open_ended.question: Give two examples of how plants adapt to their environment. 舉出兩個植物如何適應環境的例子。
Explain why some animals migrate to different places during certain seasons. 解釋為什麼一些動物在某些季節會遷徙到不同的地方。
Describe one feature of a penguin that helps it survive in cold climates. 描述企鵝的一個特徵，這個特徵幫助牠在寒冷的氣候中生存。

true_false.statement: All plants have the same features to adapt to their environment. 所有植物都有相同的特徵來適應環境。
Hibernation is a behavior that helps animals survive cold winters. 冬眠是一種幫助動物度過寒冷冬天的行為。
Animals cannot change their behaviors to adapt to different environments. 動物無法改變牠們的行為來適應不同的環境。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware of some different natural environments (e.g. tropical rainforest, temperate grassland, polar regions, desert)
Relate common animals and plants to the natural environments
Understand that some living things in an ecosystem compete with each other for resources (e.g. light, food, living space)

mcq.question: Which natural environment is known for its extremely cold temperatures and ice-covered landscapes? 哪種自然環境以其極冷的溫度和冰覆蓋的景觀而聞名?
Which animal is commonly found in a tropical rainforest? 哪種動物常見於熱帶雨林?
What do plants in a desert need to survive? 沙漠中的植物需要什麼來生存?

options.label: A
options.text: Lots of water 大量的水

options.label: B
options.text: Very little water 非常少的水

mcq.question: Which of these is a characteristic of temperate grasslands? 以下哪項是溫帶草原的特徵?

options.label: B
options.text: Lots of rainfall 大量的降雨

options.label: C
options.text: Flat land with grasses 平坦的草地

options.label: D
options.text: Very hot all year 全年非常炎熱

mcq.question: What do animals in an ecosystem compete for? 生態系統中的動物競爭什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Food and living space 食物和生存空間

options.label: C
options.text: Only living space 只有生存空間

mcq.question: Which plant is adapted to live in a desert? 哪種植物適應在沙漠中生活?
Which animal is NOT found in polar regions? 哪種動物不在極地地區?
What is the main resource plants compete for in a dense forest? 在茂密的森林中，植物主要競爭什麼資源?
Which natural environment has the most biodiversity? 哪種自然環境的生物多樣性最豐富?
Why do animals compete in an ecosystem? 為什麼動物在生態系統中競爭?

options.label: A
options.text: To have fun 為了玩樂

options.label: B
options.text: To survive and reproduce 為了生存和繁殖

options.label: C
options.text: To make friends 為了交朋友

options.label: D
options.text: To explore new places 為了探索新地方

open_ended.question: Name two animals that live in the polar regions and describe how they survive in the cold. 列出兩種生活在極地地區的動物，並描述它們如何在寒冷中生存。
Explain why plants in a desert have thick stems or leaves. 解釋為什麼沙漠中的植物有粗莖或厚葉。
Give an example of how animals compete for resources in an ecosystem. 舉一個例子說明動物如何在生態系統中競爭資源。

true_false.statement: All plants need the same amount of water to survive. 所有植物都需要相同的水量來生存。
Polar bears are adapted to live in hot deserts. 北極熊適應生活在炎熱的沙漠中。
Animals in an ecosystem often compete for food and space. 生態系統中的動物經常競爭食物和空間。

learning_objectives.objective: Describe the role of each living thing in a simple food chain (e.g. plants produce their own food, some animals eat plants, some animals eat other animals)
Identify common predators and their prey, and describe their relationships

mcq.question: What is the role of plants in a food chain? 植物在食物鏈中的角色是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: They produce their own food 它們自己製造食物

options.label: B
options.text: They eat other animals 它們吃其他動物

options.label: C
options.text: They break down dead organisms 它們分解死去的生物

options.label: D
options.text: They do not have a role 它們沒有角色

mcq.question: Which of the following is a predator-prey relationship? 以下哪個是捕食者與獵物的關係?

options.label: A
options.text: Lion and grass 獅子和草

options.label: B
options.text: Rabbit and carrot 兔子和胡蘿蔔

options.label: C
options.text: Fox and rabbit 狐狸和兔子

options.label: D
options.text: Tree and sunlight 樹和陽光

mcq.question: What do we call animals that eat plants? 我們稱吃植物的動物為什麼?
Which of the following is a producer in a food chain? 以下哪個是食物鏈中的生產者?
What is the role of decomposers in a food chain? 分解者在食物鏈中的角色是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: They produce food for others 它們為其他生物製造食物

options.label: B
options.text: They break down dead organisms 它們分解死去的生物

options.label: C
options.text: They hunt other animals 它們獵捕其他動物

options.label: D
options.text: They only eat plants 它們只吃植物

mcq.question: Which animal is a predator in this food chain: grass → rabbit → fox? 在食物鏈「草 → 兔子 → 狐狸」中，哪個動物是捕食者?

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: What do carnivores eat? 肉食動物吃什麼?

options.label: B
options.text: Only other animals 只吃其他動物

options.label: C
options.text: Both plants and animals 植物和動物都吃

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT part of a food chain? 以下哪個不屬於食物鏈的一部分?
What happens if all the plants in a food chain die? 如果食物鏈中的所有植物都死亡，會發生什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Nothing changes 沒有任何變化

options.label: B
options.text: Only herbivores are affected 只有草食動物受影響

options.label: C
options.text: The entire food chain is affected 整個食物鏈都會受影響

options.label: D
options.text: Only carnivores are affected 只有肉食動物受影響

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of a prey animal? 以下哪個是獵物動物的例子?

open_ended.question: Give an example of a simple food chain and describe the role of each living thing in it. 舉一個簡單食物鏈的例子，並描述其中每個生物的角色。
Why are plants important in a food chain? 為什麼植物在食物鏈中很重要?
What might happen if a predator is removed from a food chain? 如果從食物鏈中移除一個捕食者，可能會發生什麼?

true_false.statement: All animals in a food chain are predators. 食物鏈中的所有動物都是捕食者。
Plants are producers because they can make their own food. 植物是生產者，因為它們可以自己製造食物。
A food chain always starts with a carnivore. 食物鏈總是以肉食動物開始。

learning_objectives.objective: Compare some physical properties (electrical conductivity and thermal conductivity) of metals and non-metals
Relate the properties of metals to their uses (e.g. copper which conducts electricity well can be used to make electrical wires; iron that conducts heat well can be used to make cooking utensils)
Determine whether a material is suitable for thermal conduction or thermal insulation based on its properties

mcq.question: Which material is a good conductor of electricity? 哪種材料是良好的電導體?
Why is iron commonly used to make cooking utensils? 為什麼鐵常用來製作烹飪用具?

options.label: A
options.text: It conducts heat well 它導熱性好

options.label: C
options.text: It does not rust 它不會生鏽

options.label: D
options.text: It is cheap 它很便宜

mcq.question: Which of the following is a non-metal? 以下哪種是非金屬?

options.label: A
options.text: High electrical conductivity 高導電性

options.label: B
options.text: High thermal insulation 高隔熱性

options.label: A
options.text: Good conductor of heat 良好的導熱體

options.label: B
options.text: Poor conductor of electricity 不良的導電體

options.label: B
options.text: It is too heavy 它太重

options.label: C
options.text: It melts easily 它容易熔化

options.label: D
options.text: It is too expensive 它太貴

mcq.question: Which metal is commonly used for making coins? 哪種金屬常用於製作硬幣?
What is the main reason for using aluminum in cooking foil? 使用鋁製作烹飪箔的主要原因是什么?

options.label: A
options.text: It conducts heat well 它導熱性好

options.label: B
options.text: It is magnetic 它有磁性

options.label: C
options.text: It is transparent 它是透明的

options.label: D
options.text: It is very heavy 它非常重

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a property of metals? 以下哪項不是金屬的特性?

open_ended.question: Give two examples of metals and explain one use for each based on their properties. 舉出兩種金屬的例子，並根據它們的特性解釋每種金屬的一個用途。
Why is it important to use materials with good thermal insulation in buildings? 為什麼在建築物中使用具有良好隔熱性能的材料很重要?
Describe an experiment to test whether a material is a good conductor of heat. 描述一個實驗來測試一種材料是否是良好的導熱體。

true_false.statement: All metals are good conductors of electricity. 所有金屬都是良好的電導體。
Plastic is a better thermal conductor than metal. 塑膠的導熱性比金屬好。
Iron is used to make cooking utensils because it conducts heat well. 鐵用於製作烹飪用具是因為它導熱性好。

learning_objectives.objective: Identify some visible changes that do not produce new matter (physical changes) (e.g. dissolving, evaporation, squeezing or stretching objects)
Identify some visible changes that produce new matter (chemical changes) (e.g. rusting, burning, food rotting)

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of a physical change? 以下哪一個是物理變化的例子?

options.label: B
options.text: Dissolving sugar in water 將糖溶解在水中

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of a chemical change? 以下哪一個是化學變化的例子?

options.label: D
options.text: Stretching a rubber band 拉伸橡皮筋

mcq.question: What happens during a physical change? 在物理變化過程中會發生什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: New matter is produced 產生新物質

options.label: B
options.text: The matter changes its state or shape 物質的狀態或形狀改變

options.label: C
options.text: The matter disappears 物質消失

options.label: D
options.text: The matter becomes heavier 物質變重

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a physical change? 以下哪一個不是物理變化?

options.label: B
options.text: Dissolving salt in water 將鹽溶解在水中

options.label: C
options.text: Rusting of a nail 釘子生鏽

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Change in shape 形狀變化

options.label: C
options.text: Change in size 大小變化

options.label: D
options.text: Change in position 位置變化

mcq.question: What happens when you stretch a rubber band? 當你拉伸橡皮筋時會發生什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: A chemical change occurs 發生化學變化

options.label: B
options.text: A physical change occurs 發生物理變化

options.label: C
options.text: New matter is produced 產生新物質

options.label: D
options.text: The rubber band disappears 橡皮筋消失

mcq.question: Which of the following is a chemical change? 以下哪一個是化學變化?
What type of change is evaporation? 蒸發屬於哪一種變化?
Which of the following is NOT a chemical change? 以下哪一個不是化學變化?

open_ended.question: Give two examples of physical changes and explain why they are physical changes. 舉出兩個物理變化的例子並解釋為什麼它們是物理變化。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that friction is the resistance that occurs when objects rub against each other

mcq.question: What is friction? 什麼是摩擦力?

options.label: A
options.text: A force that pulls objects towards each other 一種將物體拉向彼此的力

options.label: B
options.text: A force that resists motion when objects rub against each other 一種當物體相互摩擦時阻礙運動的力

options.label: C
options.text: A force that makes objects move faster 一種使物體移動更快的力

options.label: D
options.text: A force that only works in water 一種只在水裡起作用的力

options.label: A
options.text: A ball rolling on a smooth floor 球在光滑的地板上滾動

options.label: B
options.text: Writing with a pencil on paper 用鉛筆在紙上寫字

options.label: C
options.text: A magnet attracting a metal object 磁鐵吸引金屬物體

options.label: D
options.text: Light shining from a lamp 燈發出的光

options.label: D
options.text: Nothing will happen 什麼都不會發生

options.label: A
options.text: It makes the object move faster 它使物體移動得更快

options.label: B
options.text: It slows down or stops the object 它減慢或停止物體

options.label: C
options.text: It changes the color of the object 它改變物體的顏色

options.label: D
options.text: It makes the object invisible 它使物體隱形

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.text: To make the tires lighter 為了使輪胎更輕

options.label: D
options.text: To make the car go faster 為了使汽車跑得更快

open_ended.question: Give two examples of how friction is useful in daily life. 舉出兩個日常生活中摩擦力有用的例子。

true_false.statement: Friction always helps objects move faster. 摩擦力總是幫助物體移動得更快。

Walking on ice is easy because there is a lot of friction. 在冰上行走很容易，因為有很大的摩擦力。

learning_objectives.objective: State the difference between weather and climate

mcq.question: What is the main difference between weather and climate? 天氣和氣候的主要區別是什麼?

options.text: Weather is short-term, climate is long-term. 天氣是短期的，氣候是長期的。

options.text: Weather is long-term, climate is short-term. 天氣是長期的，氣候是短期的。

options.label: C
options.text: Weather and climate are the same. 天氣和氣候是一樣的。

options.label: D
options.text: Weather is only about rain, climate is only about temperature. 天氣只關於雨，氣候只關於溫度。

mcq.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of climate? 以下哪一項是氣候的特徵?

options.label: A
options.text: Daily temperature changes. 每日溫度變化。

options.label: B
options.text: Average rainfall over 30 years. 30年的平均降雨量。

mcq.question: Which region is likely to have a tropical climate? 哪個地區可能有熱帶氣候?

options.label: A
options.text: Near the North Pole. 靠近北極。

options.label: B
options.text: Near the equator. 靠近赤道。

options.label: C
options.text: In a desert. 在沙漠中。

options.label: D
options.text: On a mountain top. 在山頂上。

options.text: Hot days and cold nights. 炎熱的白天和寒冷的夜晚。

options.label: B
options.text: The average temperature in July is 30°C. 七月的平均溫度是30°C。

options.label: C
options.text: It is windy today. 今天有風。

options.label: D
options.text: There was a thunderstorm last night. 昨晚有雷暴。

options.label: D
options.text: Average humidity over 10 years. 10年的平均濕度。

mcq.question: What is a common climate characteristic of a rainforest? 雨林常見的氣候特徵是什麼?

options.label: D

mcq.question: Which of the following is true about weather? 以下關於天氣的說法哪一項是正確的?

options.label: B
options.text: It changes every day. 它每天都在變化。

options.label: C

options.label: D

mcq.question: What is a common weather characteristic in a temperate region? 溫帶地區常見的天氣特徵是什麼?

options.label: B

open_ended.question: Describe one difference between weather and climate. 描述天氣和氣候之間的一個區別。

true_false.statement: Weather and climate mean the same thing. 天氣和氣候的意思是一樣的。

Deserts have high rainfall throughout the year. 沙漠全年降雨量高。

learning_objectives.objective: Show concern for the phenomenon of global warming and its impacts (e.g. glacier melting, rising sea levels, desertification)

options.label: C
options.text: Drive cars more often 更常開車

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.text: Land turning into desert 土地變成沙漠

themes.topic_name: Some phenomena and patterns observed on the Earth caused by the movements of the Sun, Earth and Moon

learning_objectives.objective: Explain the relationship between the changes of day and night and the rotation of the Earth
Be aware that the Earth’s axis is tilted
Explain that the difference in seasons in the Earth’s northern and southern hemispheres are related to the Earth’s revolution around the Sun and tilted axis

mcq.question: What causes day and night on Earth? 地球上晝夜變化的原因是什麼?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The Moon's rotation around the Earth 月球繞著地球轉動

options.label: D
options.text: The Sun's movement around the galaxy 太陽繞著銀河系運動

mcq.question: Why does the Earth have seasons? 為什麼地球有季節變化?

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: The Moon's gravity 月球的引力

mcq.question: Which movement of the Earth causes a year? 地球的哪種運動造成一年的時間?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Tilting of the axis 地軸傾斜

options.label: D

mcq.question: What happens when one side of the Earth faces the Sun? 當地球的一側面向太陽時會發生什麼?

options.label: B

mcq.question: Why do we have longer days in summer? 為什麼夏季的白天較長?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Because the Sun shines brighter 因為太陽更亮

options.label: D

mcq.question: How does the Earth move to cause day and night? 地球如何運動導致晝夜變化?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It moves around the Sun 它繞太陽運動

options.label: C
options.text: It moves closer to the Sun 它靠近太陽

options.label: D
options.text: It moves away from the Sun 它遠離太陽

mcq.question: What is the angle of the Earth's tilt? 地球的地軸傾斜角度是多少?

open_ended.question: Explain why the southern hemisphere experiences winter when the northern hemisphere has summer. 解釋為什麼當北半球是夏季時，南半球是冬季。

What would happen if the Earth's axis was not tilted? 如果地球的地軸沒有傾斜，會發生什麼?

true_false.statement: The Earth's rotation causes the seasons. 地球的自轉導致季節變化。

themes.theme_name: Scientific Process and Spirit of Science

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise that scientific knowledge is derived from systematic observation, testing and analysis, through which imagination and creativity are required
Recognise the concept of fair testing
Be aware that scientific knowledge is subject to change as new evidence becomes available (e.g. the change from “Flat Earth Theory” to “Round Earth Theory”)

mcq.question: What is the first step in the scientific inquiry process? 科學探究過程的第一步是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Make an observation 進行觀察

options.label: B
options.text: Draw a conclusion 得出結論

options.label: C
options.text: Conduct an experiment 進行實驗

options.label: D
options.text: Ask a question 提出問題

mcq.question: What is a fair test in science? 什麼是科學中的公平測試?

options.label: A
options.text: A test where only one variable is changed 只改變一個變量的測試

options.label: B
options.text: A test where all variables are changed 改變所有變量的測試

options.label: C
options.text: A test with no variables 沒有變量的測試

options.label: D
options.text: A test with no results 沒有結果的測試

mcq.question: Why is imagination important in science? 為什麼想像力在科學中很重要?

options.label: A
options.text: It helps scientists create new ideas and hypotheses 幫助科學家創造新的想法和假設

options.label: B
options.text: It makes experiments more fun 使實驗更有趣

options.label: C
options.text: It is not important in science 在科學中不重要

options.label: D
options.text: It helps scientists draw conclusions 幫助科學家得出結論

mcq.question: What happens when new evidence is found in science? 當科學中發現新證據時會發生什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Scientific knowledge may change 科學知識可能會改變

options.label: B
options.text: Nothing changes 沒有任何變化

options.label: C
options.text: Scientists stop researching 科學家停止研究

options.label: D
options.text: The evidence is ignored 證據被忽略

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of scientific knowledge changing? 以下哪個是科學知識改變的例子?

options.label: A
options.text: From Flat Earth to Round Earth 從地平說到地圓說

options.label: B
options.text: From Round Earth to Flat Earth 從地圓說到地平說

options.label: C
options.text: From Round Earth to Square Earth 從地圓說到地方說

options.label: D
options.text: From Flat Earth to Square Earth 從地平說到地方說

mcq.question: What is the purpose of testing in science? 科學中測試的目的是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To gather evidence and support hypotheses 收集證據並支持假設

options.label: B
options.text: To make science more difficult 使科學更困難

options.label: C
options.text: To ignore the results 忽略結果

options.label: D
options.text: To make science more fun 使科學更有趣

mcq.question: What is a hypothesis in science? 科學中的假設是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: An educated guess based on observations 基於觀察的有根據的猜測

options.label: B
options.text: A final answer to a question 問題的最終答案

options.label: C
options.text: A random idea 隨機的想法

options.label: D
options.text: A type of experiment 一種實驗

mcq.question: Why is creativity important in science? 為什麼創造力在科學中很重要?

options.label: A
options.text: It helps scientists design experiments and solve problems 幫助科學家設計實驗和解決問題

options.label: B
options.text: It makes science more colorful 使科學更有色彩

options.label: C
options.text: It is not important in science 在科學中不重要

options.label: D
options.text: It helps scientists memorize facts 幫助科學家記憶事實

mcq.question: What is the role of analysis in science? 分析在科學中的作用是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To interpret data and draw conclusions 解釋數據並得出結論

options.label: B
options.text: To ignore data 忽略數據

options.label: C
options.text: To make data more complicated 使數據更複雜

options.label: D
options.text: To create more questions 創造更多問題

mcq.question: What is the final step in the scientific inquiry process? 科學探究過程的最後一步是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Communicate the results 交流結果

options.label: B
options.text: Ask a question 提出問題

options.label: C
options.text: Make an observation 進行觀察

options.label: D
options.text: Conduct an experiment 進行實驗

open_ended.question: Give an example of how scientific knowledge has changed over time. 舉一個科學知識隨時間變化的例子。
Why is it important to change only one variable in a fair test? 為什麼在公平測試中只改變一個變量很重要?
How can imagination help scientists in their work? 想像力如何幫助科學家的工作?

true_false.statement: Scientific knowledge never changes. 科學知識永遠不會改變。
A fair test involves changing multiple variables at the same time. 公平測試涉及同時改變多個變量。
Observation is the first step in the scientific inquiry process. 觀察是科學探究過程的第一步。

themes.topic_name: The nation’s and the world’s aerospace technology development

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the applications and impact of artificial satellites in daily life (e.g. satellite positioning, weather observations)
Give some examples of everyday products that incorporate space technology (e.g. shoe insoles, scratch resistant lenses, drinks in squeeze pouch)
Be aware of the achievements and contributions of some of the nation’s astronauts
Recognise the life of astronauts in space
Appreciate the nation’s contributions to the development of aerospace technology

mcq.question: Which of the following is an application of artificial satellites? 以下哪項是人造衛星的應用？

options.label: B
options.text: To cook food 烹飪食物

options.label: D
options.text: To build houses 建造房屋

What do astronauts eat in space? 太空人在太空中吃什麼？

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Fresh fruits only 只有新鮮水果

open_ended.question: How do artificial satellites help in our daily lives? Give two examples. 人造衛星如何在我們的日常生活中提供幫助？舉兩個例子。

true_false.statement: Artificial satellites are used for weather observations. 人造衛星用於天氣觀測。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware of the basic steps of the design process

Apply design cycle to design engineering models or products: Identify needs and the problem, Collect information relevant to the problem, and briefly evaluate existing approaches, Propose a design solution that meets the constraints, Illustrate the design idea by a sketch, Use simple tools and materials to make the engineering model or product, Test and improve the engineering model or product by considering practicality and aesthetics, Communicate briefly the solutions to the problem

mcq.question: What is the first step in the design cycle? 設計循環的第一步是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Identify needs and the problem 識別需求和問題

options.label: C
options.text: Propose a design solution 提出設計方案

options.label: D
options.text: Test the product 測試產品

mcq.question: Why is it important to collect information before designing a product? 為什麼在設計產品之前收集信息很重要?

options.label: A
options.text: To save time 為了節省時間

options.label: B
options.text: To understand the problem better 為了更好地理解問題

options.label: C
options.text: To skip the testing step 為了跳過測試步驟

options.label: D
options.text: To make the product look pretty 為了讓產品看起來漂亮

mcq.question: What should you do after proposing a design solution? 提出設計方案後應該做什麼?

options.label: C
options.text: Ignore the constraints 忽略限制條件

options.label: D
options.text: Stop the design process 停止設計過程

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a step in the design cycle? 以下哪一項不是設計循環的步驟?

options.label: A
options.text: Identify needs and the problem 識別需求和問題

options.label: C
options.text: Forget about the problem 忘記問題

options.label: D
options.text: Test and improve the product 測試和改進產品

mcq.question: What is the purpose of testing an engineering model? 測試工程模型的目的是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To find and fix problems 發現並解決問題

options.label: B
options.text: To make it look colorful 讓它看起來色彩繽紛

options.label: C
options.text: To skip the design process 跳過設計過程

options.label: D
options.text: To make it heavier 讓它更重

mcq.question: Which tool is commonly used to make a simple engineering model? 哪種工具常用於製作簡單的工程模型?

options.label: A
options.text: Scissors and glue 剪刀和膠水

options.label: B
options.text: A computer only 僅用電腦

options.label: C
options.text: A hammer only 僅用錘子

options.label: D
options.text: A paintbrush only 僅用畫筆

mcq.question: What should you consider when improving a product? 改進產品時應該考慮什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Practicality and aesthetics 實用性和美觀性

options.label: B
options.text: Only the color 僅考慮顏色

options.label: C
options.text: Only the size 僅考慮大小

options.label: D
options.text: Only the weight 僅考慮重量

mcq.question: Why is it important to communicate the design solution? 為什麼溝通設計方案很重要?

options.label: A
options.text: To share ideas and get feedback 分享想法並獲得反饋

options.label: B
options.text: To keep it a secret 保密

options.label: C
options.text: To avoid testing 避免測試

options.label: D
options.text: To make it more expensive 讓它更昂貴

mcq.question: What is the final step in the design cycle? 設計循環的最後一步是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Communicate the solution 溝通解決方案

options.label: B
options.text: Identify the problem 識別問題

options.label: D
options.text: Propose a design 提出設計

mcq.question: Which of the following is a constraint in design? 以下哪一項是設計中的限制條件?

options.label: C
options.text: No problem to solve 沒有問題需要解決

options.label: D
options.text: No need for testing 不需要測試

open_ended.question: Describe one step in the design cycle and explain why it is important. 描述設計循環中的一個步驟並解釋為什麼它很重要。

true_false.statement: The first step in the design cycle is to propose a design solution. 設計循環的第一步是提出設計方案。

mcq.question: Why is nutrition important during adolescence? 為什麼營養在青春期很重要?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect 它沒有影響

mcq.question: What is a common physical change in males during adolescence? 男性在青春期常見的身體變化是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Development of breasts 乳房發育

options.label: B
options.text: Deepening of voice 聲音變低沉

options.label: C
options.text: No physical changes 沒有身體變化

options.label: D

mcq.question: Which stage follows childhood in the human life cycle? 人類生命週期中，兒童期之後是哪個階段?
What should adolescents do to support healthy growth and development? 青少年應該做什麼來支持健康的成長和發育?

open_ended.question: Describe two physiological changes that occur during adolescence. 描述青春期發生的兩個生理變化。

true_false.statement: Adolescence is the stage between childhood and adulthood. 青春期是兒童期和成年期之間的階段。

themes.theme_name: Inter-relationship between Living Things and the Natural Environment
themes.topic_name: Impact of human behavior on the natural environment

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise some methods of pollution testing
Give some approaches in the application of science and technology to address environmental issues
Recognise the importance of sustainable development and environmental protection to maintaining ecological security

mcq.question: Which of the following is a method to test water pollution? 以下哪一種是測試水污染的方法?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Recording wind speed 記錄風速

options.label: D
options.text: Measuring temperature only 僅測量溫度

mcq.question: What is one way science and technology can help reduce air pollution? 科學和技術可以如何幫助減少空氣污染?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Cutting down trees 砍伐樹木

mcq.question: Why is sustainable development important? 為什麼可持續發展很重要?

options.text: To protect resources for future generations 為子孫後代保護資源

options.label: B

options.text: To ignore environmental problems 忽略環境問題

options.label: D
options.text: To increase pollution 增加污染

options.label: C
options.text: Using solar energy 使用太陽能

mcq.question: What can we do to reduce plastic pollution? 我們可以做什麼來減少塑膠污染?

options.label: B
options.text: Throw plastic everywhere 隨處丟棄塑膠

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Buy more single-use plastics 購買更多一次性塑膠製品

options.label: A
options.text: Air quality sensors 空氣質量傳感器

mcq.question: What is the main goal of environmental protection? 環境保護的主要目標是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To preserve natural resources 保護自然資源

options.label: B
options.text: To increase pollution 增加污染

options.label: C
options.text: To destroy habitats 破壞棲息地

mcq.question: Which human activity causes deforestation? 哪種人類活動導致森林砍伐?

options.label: A
options.text: Cutting trees for agriculture 為農業砍伐樹木

options.label: B
options.text: Planting more trees 種植更多樹木

options.label: D
options.text: Using solar energy 使用太陽能

mcq.question: How does recycling help the environment? 回收如何幫助環境?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduces waste in landfills 減少垃圾填埋場的廢物

options.label: C
options.text: Uses more resources 使用更多資源

mcq.question: What is ecological security? 什麼是生態安全?

options.label: A
options.text: Protecting ecosystems for future generations 為子孫後代保護生態系統

options.label: B
options.text: Ignoring environmental problems 忽略環境問題

options.label: D
options.text: Cutting down all trees 砍伐所有樹木

open_ended.question: Describe one method to test air pollution and explain how it works. 描述一種測試空氣污染的方法並解釋其工作原理。
How can science and technology help solve the problem of plastic pollution? Give one example. 科學和技術如何幫助解決塑膠污染問題？舉一個例子。
Why is it important to protect the natural environment? Give two reasons. 為什麼保護自然環境很重要？給出兩個理由。

true_false.statement: Burning fossil fuels does not contribute to air pollution. 燃燒化石燃料不會造成空氣污染。
Sustainable development aims to meet current needs without harming future generations. 可持續發展旨在滿足當前需求而不損害子孫後代。
Recycling paper helps reduce deforestation. 回收紙張有助於減少森林砍伐。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise common types of microorganisms (including bacteria, fungi, viruses)
Recognise the uses of antibiotics and the effects of inappropriate use of antibiotics
Recognise the benefits (e.g. probiotics inhibiting the growth of harmful bacteria, degrading pollutants) and negative impacts (e.g. causing diseases) of microorganisms to humans

mcq.question: Which of the following is a type of microorganism? 以下哪一種是微生物的類型?

options.label: A
options.text: To kill bacteria 殺死細菌

options.label: C
options.text: To grow plants 種植植物

options.label: D
options.text: To cook food 烹飪食物

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Food tastes better 食物味道更好

options.label: C
options.text: Making water dirty 使水變髒

mcq.question: What type of microorganism causes the flu? 哪種微生物會引起流感?

options.label: B
options.text: Yeast (a type of fungus) 酵母（一種真菌）

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a microorganism? 以下哪一項不是微生物?

open_ended.question: Give two examples of how microorganisms are beneficial to humans. 舉出兩個微生物對人類有益的示例。
Explain why inappropriate use of antibiotics is a problem. 解釋為什麼不當使用抗生素是一個問題。

true_false.statement: All microorganisms are harmful to humans. 所有微生物對人類都是有害的。
Antibiotics can kill viruses. 抗生素可以殺死病毒。
Probiotics are good bacteria that help our digestion. 益生菌是有助於消化的有益細菌。

learning_objectives.objective: State the major components of air and their percentage of composition in air
Be aware that air has weight and occupies space
Give some examples of daily phenomena related to atmospheric pressure (e.g. suck air out through a straw will cause the beverage carton to cave in)
Be aware that air rises when heated, and the movement of air forms wind

mcq.question: What is the main component of air? 空氣的主要成分是什麼？

options.text: A carton caving in when you suck air out through a straw 用吸管吸出空氣時，飲料盒會凹陷

open_ended.question: Name two major components of air and their approximate percentages. 列出空氣的兩種主要成分及其大致百分比。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the necessary conditions for corrosion of metals (using rusting as an example)
Explain ways to prevent corrosion of metals
Be aware of some reversible changes (e.g. condensation and evaporation of water) and irreversible changes (e.g. burning)

mcq.question: Which of the following is necessary for the rusting of iron? 以下哪項是鐵生鏽的必要條件?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Carbon dioxide and heat 二氧化碳和熱

options.label: C
options.text: Nitrogen and light 氮氣和光

options.label: D
options.text: Hydrogen and cold 氫氣和冷

mcq.question: Which of the following is a way to prevent rusting? 以下哪種方法可以防止生鏽?

options.label: A
options.text: Painting the metal 給金屬塗漆

options.label: B
options.text: Exposing the metal to rain 將金屬暴露在雨中

options.text: Keeping the metal wet 保持金屬濕潤

options.label: D
options.text: Storing the metal in saltwater 將金屬存放在鹽水中

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of a reversible change? 以下哪個是可逆變化的例子?
Which of the following is an example of an irreversible change? 以下哪個是不可逆變化的例子?
What is the main cause of corrosion in metals? 金屬腐蝕的主要原因是什么?

options.label: A
options.text: Reaction with oxygen 與氧氣反應

options.label: B
options.text: Reaction with nitrogen 與氮氣反應

options.label: C
options.text: Reaction with hydrogen 與氫氣反應

options.label: D
options.text: Reaction with helium 與氦氣反應

mcq.question: Which of the following metals is most likely to rust? 以下哪種金屬最有可能生鏽?

options.label: A
options.text: It changes from liquid to gas 它從液體變成氣體

options.label: B
options.text: It changes from gas to liquid 它從氣體變成液體

options.label: C
options.text: It changes from solid to liquid 它從固體變成液體

options.label: D
options.text: It changes from liquid to solid 它從液體變成固體

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a way to prevent rusting? 以下哪種方法不能防止生鏽?

options.label: B
options.text: Keeping the metal dry 保持金屬乾燥

options.label: C
options.text: Exposing the metal to air and water 將金屬暴露在空氣和水中

mcq.question: What is the process called when water vapor turns into liquid water? 當水蒸氣變成液態水時，這個過程叫什麼?
Which of the following is a chemical change? 以下哪個是化學變化?

open_ended.question: Explain why painting a metal gate can prevent it from rusting. 解釋為什麼給金屬門塗漆可以防止它生鏽。
Give two examples of reversible changes and two examples of irreversible changes. 舉出兩個可逆變化的例子和兩個不可逆變化的例子。
Describe the conditions needed for iron to rust. 描述鐵生鏽所需的條件。

true_false.statement: Rusting is a reversible change. 生鏽是可逆的變化。
Condensation is the process of water vapor turning into liquid water. 凝結是水蒸氣變成液態水的過程。
Burning paper is a physical change. 燃燒紙張是物理變化。

themes.theme_name: Forms of Energy and Energy Transfer

learning_objectives.objective: Give examples of the different forms of energy (e.g. kinetic energy, potential energy, chemical energy)

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of kinetic energy? 以下哪個是動能的例子?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: A burning candle 燃燒的蠟燭

options.label: D
options.text: A moving car 行駛中的汽車

What form of energy is used to power a flashlight? 手電筒使用哪種形式的能量?
Which of the following is an example of potential energy? 以下哪個是勢能的例子?

options.label: A
options.text: A flying bird 飛翔的鳥

options.label: B
options.text: A running child 奔跑的孩子

options.label: C
options.text: A book on a table 桌子上的書

options.label: D
options.text: A spinning top 旋轉的陀螺

mcq.question: What form of energy is produced by a guitar when it is played? 彈奏吉他時產生哪種形式的能量?

true_false.statement: Energy can be created and destroyed. 能量可以被創造和毀滅。

themes.topic_name: Properties of sound and related phenomena

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that sound can travel through different media
Be aware that changes in pitch are caused by changes in vibration
Recognise the causes of noise and ways to cope with it
Recognise the ways to protect hearing
Recognise ways to measure the loudness of sound, and the commonly used unit (decibel)

mcq.question: Through which of the following can sound NOT travel? 聲音不能通過以下哪種介質傳播?

options.text: Changes in medium 介質的變化

options.text: Changes in temperature 溫度的變化

options.label: A
options.text: Avoid loud noises 避免巨大噪音

options.label: D

Which of the following actions can help reduce noise pollution? 以下哪項行動可以幫助減少噪音污染?

options.label: B
options.text: Using quieter machines 使用更安靜的機器

options.label: C
options.text: Both A and B A和B都是

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上都不是

true_false.statement: Sound travels faster in water than in air. 聲音在水中比在空氣中傳播得更快。

themes.topic_name: Properties of electricity and related phenomena

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise how to use electricity safely
Explain the reasons why different parts of household appliances are made from conductive and insulating materials respectively

mcq.question: Which material is commonly used as an insulator in electrical wires? 哪種材料通常用作電線的絕緣體?
Why should you never touch electrical appliances with wet hands? 為什麼不應該用濕手觸摸電器?

options.label: A
options.text: Water makes the appliance dirty 水會弄髒電器

options.label: B
options.text: Water can conduct electricity and cause electric shock 水能導電並導致觸電

options.label: C
options.text: Water can damage the appliance 水會損壞電器

options.label: D
options.text: Water makes the appliance slippery 水會使電器變滑

mcq.question: Which of the following is a good conductor of electricity? 以下哪種是良好的導電體?
What is the purpose of using insulating materials in household appliances? 家用電器使用絕緣材料的目的是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To make the appliance look colorful 使電器看起來色彩繽紛

options.label: B
options.text: To prevent electric shocks 防止觸電

options.label: C
options.text: To make the appliance heavier 使電器更重

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce the cost of the appliance 降低電器的成本

mcq.question: Which of the following actions is safe when using electricity? 以下哪種行為在使用電力時是安全的?

options.label: A
options.text: Pulling a plug by its cord 拉電線拔出插頭

options.label: B
options.text: Using a damaged wire 使用損壞的電線

options.label: C
options.text: Turning off the power before repairing an appliance 修理電器前關閉電源

options.label: D
options.text: Inserting metal objects into sockets 將金屬物體插入插座

mcq.question: What happens when too many appliances are plugged into one socket? 當太多電器插在同一個插座時會發生什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: The socket becomes colorful 插座會變得色彩繽紛

options.label: B
options.text: It can cause overheating and a fire 可能導致過熱和火災

options.label: C
options.text: The appliances work faster 電器會工作得更快

options.label: D
options.text: Nothing happens 什麼都不會發生

mcq.question: Which part of a plug is usually made of insulating material? 插頭的哪個部分通常由絕緣材料製成?

options.label: A
options.text: The metal pins 金屬插腳

options.label: C
options.text: The wires inside 內部的電線

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上全部

mcq.question: Why are electrical wires usually made of copper? 為什麼電線通常由銅製成?

options.label: A
options.text: Copper is a good conductor of electricity 銅是良好的導電體

options.label: B
options.text: Copper is cheap 銅很便宜

options.label: C
options.text: Copper is colorful 銅色彩繽紛

mcq.question: What should you do if you see a damaged electrical wire? 如果你看到損壞的電線，你應該怎麼做?

options.label: A
options.text: Touch it to see if it is still working 觸摸它看看是否還能工作

options.label: B
options.text: Tell an adult and stay away from it 告訴成年人並遠離它

options.label: C
options.text: Use tape to fix it yourself 自己用膠帶修復它

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a safe practice with electricity? 以下哪種行為在使用電力時是不安全的?

options.label: A
options.text: Using a plug with a safety mark 使用帶有安全標誌的插頭

options.label: B
options.text: Overloading a socket 使插座超負荷

options.label: C
options.text: Keeping electrical appliances away from water 讓電器遠離水

options.label: D
options.text: Turning off appliances when not in use 不使用時關閉電器

open_ended.question: Explain why the outer casing of a plug is made of insulating material. 解釋為什麼插頭的外殼由絕緣材料製成。
Describe two safety rules you should follow when using electrical appliances. 描述使用電器時應遵循的兩條安全規則。
Why is it important to use conductive materials for the wires inside electrical appliances? 為什麼電器內部的電線使用導電材料很重要?

true_false.statement: Water is a good conductor of electricity. 水是良好的導電體。
It is safe to use a hairdryer near a bathtub filled with water. 在裝滿水的浴缸附近使用吹風機是安全的。
Insulating materials are used to protect people from electric shocks. 絕緣材料用於保護人們免受觸電。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that forces can change the state of motion of an object (forces can make a stationary object move or stop a moving object; forces can change the speed of a moving object; forces can change the direction of a moving object)
Recognise that forces always work in action and reaction pairs

Recognise methods to compare the speed of moving objects (compare the distances travelled by two objects within the same period of time, or compare the time taken for two objects to travel the same distance)

mcq.question: What can a force do to a stationary object? 力可以對靜止的物體做什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Make it move 使它移動

options.label: B
options.text: Make it disappear 使它消失

options.label: C
options.text: Make it change color 使它改變顏色

options.label: D
options.text: Make it smaller 使它變小

mcq.question: What happens when a force is applied to a moving object? 當力作用於移動的物體時會發生什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: It can stop the object 它可以停止物體

options.label: B
options.text: It can change its speed 它可以改變它的速度

options.label: C
options.text: It can change its direction 它可以改變它的方向

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: Forces always work in: 力總是成對出現，稱為：

options.label: A
options.text: Action and reaction pairs 作用力和反作用力對

mcq.question: How can you compare the speed of two moving objects? 如何比較兩個移動物體的速度？

options.label: A
options.text: Compare the distances travelled in the same time 比較相同時間內移動的距離

options.label: B
options.text: Compare the time taken to travel the same distance 比較移動相同距離所需的時間

options.label: C
options.text: Both A and B A和B都是

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: What is required to change the direction of a moving object? 改變移動物體的方向需要什麼？
Which of the following is an example of a force? 以下哪個是力的例子？

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: If two objects travel the same distance, the one that takes less time is: 如果兩個物體移動相同的距離，花費時間較少的那個物體：

options.label: C
options.text: The same speed 速度相同

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: What happens when you push a wall? 當你推牆時會發生什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: The wall pushes back 牆會推回來

options.label: B
options.text: The wall moves 牆會移動

options.label: C
options.text: Nothing happens 什麼都不會發生

options.label: D
options.text: The wall disappears 牆會消失

mcq.question: Which force is always pulling objects toward the Earth? 哪種力總是將物體拉向地球？
If a ball is rolling on the ground and slows down, what is most likely causing it? 如果一個球在地上滾動並減速，最可能的原因是什麼？

open_ended.question: Give an example of how a force can change the speed of a moving object. 舉一個例子說明力如何改變移動物體的速度。
Explain why forces always work in action and reaction pairs. 解釋為什麼力總是成對出現（作用力和反作用力）。
Describe two methods to compare the speed of two moving objects. 描述兩種比較兩個移動物體速度的方法。

true_false.statement: A force can make a stationary object move. 力可以使靜止的物體移動。
Forces can only change the speed of an object, not its direction. 力只能改變物體的速度，不能改變它的方向。
If two objects travel the same distance, the one that takes more time is faster. 如果兩個物體移動相同的距離，花費時間較多的那個物體更快。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise some different landforms (e.g. mountains, plains, valleys, plateaus, basins)
Be aware that crustal movement, water and wind play an important role in shaping landforms
Be aware that fossils are the remains of some ancient organisms preserved in rocks and ice
Be aware that changes in the Earth’s surface can be inferred from the location of fossils

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of landform? 以下哪一項不是地形的一種?
What plays an important role in shaping landforms? 什麼對地形的塑造起著重要作用?

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: Where are fossils usually found? 化石通常在哪裡被發現?

options.label: A
options.text: In rocks and ice 在岩石和冰中

options.label: B
options.text: In the ocean 在海洋中

options.label: C
options.text: In the air 在空氣中

mcq.question: What can fossils tell us about? 化石可以告訴我們什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Changes in the Earth's surface 地球表面的變化

options.label: C
options.text: Both A and B A和B都是

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: Which landform is flat and low-lying? 哪種地形是平坦且低窪的?
What are fossils? 什麼是化石?

options.label: A
options.text: Remains of ancient organisms 古代生物的遺骸

options.label: B
options.text: Newly formed rocks 新形成的岩石

options.label: C
options.text: Types of plants 植物的種類

options.label: D
options.text: Types of animals 動物的種類

mcq.question: Which of the following is a highland area with a flat top? 以下哪一項是頂部平坦的高地?
How can wind shape landforms? 風如何塑造地形?

options.label: A
options.text: By carrying sand and rocks 通過攜帶沙子和岩石

options.label: B
options.text: By blowing leaves 通過吹動樹葉

options.label: C
options.text: By making sounds 通過發出聲音

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: What is a valley? 什麼是山谷?

options.label: A
options.text: A low area between hills or mountains 山丘或山脈之間的低地

options.label: B
options.text: A high flat area 高的平坦地區

options.label: C
options.text: A deep hole in the ground 地面上的深洞

options.label: D
options.text: A large body of water 大片水域

mcq.question: Why are fossils important? 為什麼化石很重要?

options.label: A
options.text: They help us understand Earth's history 它們幫助我們了解地球的歷史

options.label: B
options.text: They are pretty to look at 它們看起來很漂亮

options.label: C
options.text: They can be used as tools 它們可以被用作工具

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

open_ended.question: Name two landforms and describe how they are formed. 列舉兩種地形並描述它們是如何形成的。
How do fossils help scientists learn about Earth's history? 化石如何幫助科學家了解地球的歷史?
Explain how water can shape landforms. 解釋水如何塑造地形。

true_false.statement: Fossils are only found in rocks. 化石只在岩石中被發現。
Mountains are formed by crustal movement. 山脈是由地殼運動形成的。
Wind cannot change the shape of landforms. 風不能改變地形的形狀。

learning_objectives.objective: Describe Hong Kong’s weather information such as temperature, wind speed, wind direction, relative humidity, rainfall, etc. based on weather data

mcq.question: What is the average temperature in Hong Kong during summer? 香港夏季的平均溫度是多少？
Which instrument is used to measure wind speed? 哪種儀器用於測量風速？
What does relative humidity measure? 相對濕度測量的是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: The amount of rainfall 降雨量

options.label: B
options.text: The amount of water vapor in the air 空氣中的水蒸氣量

options.label: C
options.text: The speed of the wind 風速

mcq.question: Which season in Hong Kong is known for heavy rainfall? 香港哪個季節以降雨量大而聞名？
What is the main wind direction in Hong Kong during winter? 香港冬季的主要風向是什麼？
Which of the following is NOT a weather element? 以下哪項不是天氣要素？
How is rainfall measured? 降雨量是如何測量的？

options.label: A
options.text: In millimeters 以毫米為單位

options.label: B
options.text: In degrees Celsius 以攝氏度為單位

options.label: C
options.text: In kilometers per hour 以每小時公里為單位

mcq.question: What is the typical relative humidity in Hong Kong during summer? 香港夏季的典型相對濕度是多少？
Which season in Hong Kong is usually the driest? 香港哪個季節通常最乾燥？
What is the primary source of Hong Kong's weather data? 香港天氣數據的主要來源是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Hong Kong Observatory 香港天文台

open_ended.question: Describe two weather characteristics of Hong Kong during summer. 描述香港夏季的兩個天氣特徵。
Why is it important to measure wind direction in weather forecasting? 為什麼在天氣預報中測量風向很重要？
How does relative humidity affect our daily life? Give one example. 相對濕度如何影響我們的日常生活？舉一個例子。

true_false.statement: Hong Kong's winter is usually warm and humid. 香港的冬季通常溫暖潮濕。
Wind speed is measured in degrees Celsius. 風速以攝氏度為單位測量。
The Hong Kong Observatory provides weather data to the public. 香港天文台向公眾提供天氣數據。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the causes of some common weather phenomena (e.g. fog, rain, snow, frost, hail)

mcq.question: What causes fog to form? 霧是如何形成的?

options.label: A
options.text: Cool air meeting warm, moist air 冷空氣遇到溫暖潮濕的空氣

options.label: B
options.text: Strong winds blowing over mountains 強風吹過山脈

options.label: C
options.text: Direct sunlight heating the ground 陽光直接加熱地面

options.label: D
options.text: Ocean waves crashing on the shore 海浪拍打岸邊

mcq.question: How is rain formed? 雨是如何形成的?

options.label: A
options.text: Water vapor condenses into droplets in clouds 水蒸氣在雲中凝結成水滴

options.label: B
options.text: Ice crystals melt as they fall 冰晶在下落時融化

options.label: C
options.text: Snowflakes combine in the air 雪花在空中結合

options.label: D
options.text: Dew evaporates from the ground 露水從地面蒸發

mcq.question: What is needed for snow to form? 雪的形成需要什麼條件?

options.label: A
options.text: Temperatures below freezing 溫度低於冰點

options.label: B
options.text: High humidity and warm air 高濕度和溫暖的空氣

options.label: D
options.text: Dry air with no clouds 乾燥無雲的空氣

mcq.question: What causes frost to appear on surfaces? 霜是如何在表面上形成的?

options.label: A
options.text: Water vapor freezing directly on cold surfaces 水蒸氣直接在冷表面上凍結

options.label: B
options.text: Rain freezing as it falls 雨在下落時凍結

options.label: C
options.text: Snow melting and refreezing 雪融化後再凍結

options.label: D
options.text: Dew evaporating quickly 露水快速蒸發

mcq.question: How is hail formed? 冰雹是如何形成的?

options.label: A
options.text: Layers of ice build up on frozen raindrops in storms 冰層在暴風雨中的凍結雨滴上堆積

options.label: B
options.text: Snowflakes clump together in clouds 雪花在雲中聚集

options.label: C
options.text: Frost forms on tree branches 霜在樹枝上形成

options.label: D
options.text: Dew freezes on the ground 露水在地面上凍結

mcq.question: Which weather phenomenon is caused by rapid cooling at night? 哪種天氣現象是由夜間快速冷卻引起的?
What is the main cause of thunderstorms? 雷暴的主要原因是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Rising warm air creating cumulonimbus clouds 上升的暖空氣形成積雨雲

options.label: B
options.text: Cold air moving over warm oceans 冷空氣流過溫暖的海洋

options.label: C
options.text: Snow melting in the mountains 山上的雪融化

options.label: D
options.text: Fog lifting in the morning 早晨的霧消散

mcq.question: Which condition is necessary for frost to form? 霜的形成需要什麼條件?

options.label: A
options.text: Temperatures below freezing and moist air 溫度低於冰點且空氣潮濕

options.label: B
options.text: Hot and dry weather 炎熱乾燥的天氣

mcq.question: What happens when water vapor cools and condenses in the air? 當水蒸氣冷卻並在空氣中凝結時會發生什麼?

options.label: C
options.text: The air becomes drier 空氣變得更乾燥

options.label: D
options.text: The temperature rises 溫度上升

mcq.question: Why does hail usually occur during thunderstorms? 為什麼冰雹通常發生在雷暴期間?

options.label: A
options.text: Strong updrafts keep ice pellets in the clouds 強烈的上升氣流使冰粒保持在雲中

options.label: B
options.text: The sun melts snowflakes 太陽融化了雪花

options.label: C
options.text: Frost forms on raindrops 霜在雨滴上形成

options.label: D
options.text: The air is very dry 空氣非常乾燥

open_ended.question: Explain how rain is different from snow. 解釋雨和雪有什麼不同。
Describe two conditions needed for fog to form. 描述霧形成所需的兩個條件。
Why is hail more common in some seasons than others? 為什麼冰雹在某些季節更常見?

true_false.statement: Frost forms when water vapor freezes directly on cold surfaces. 霜是當水蒸氣直接在冷表面上凍結時形成的。
Snow can form when the air temperature is above freezing. 當空氣溫度高於冰點時，雪也可以形成。
Hail is formed in cumulonimbus clouds during thunderstorms. 冰雹是在雷暴期間的積雨雲中形成的。

themes.topic_name: The Sun and the eight planets

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that the Sun is the star in the solar system and emits light and heat energy to other celestial bodies
Explain why other celestial bodies in the solar system can be observed even they do not emit light
Recognise the eight planets in the solar system and their basic characteristics (e.g. diameter, number of discovered natural satellites, periods of revolution and rotation)
Recognise the overview of the universe and be aware that the Milky Way is one of the many galaxies
Appreciate the vastness of the universe

mcq.question: What is the Sun? 太陽是什麼?
Why can we see planets in the solar system even though they do not emit light? 為什麼我們可以看到太陽系中的行星，即使它們不發光?

options.label: A
options.text: They reflect sunlight 它們反射太陽光

options.label: B
options.text: They have their own light 它們有自己的光

options.label: C
options.text: They are very hot 它們非常熱

options.label: D
options.text: They are made of gas 它們由氣體組成

mcq.question: Which planet is the largest in the solar system? 太陽系中哪顆行星最大?
How many natural satellites does Earth have? 地球有多少顆天然衛星?
Which planet is known for its rings? 哪顆行星以其環聞名?
What is the period of revolution for Earth around the Sun? 地球繞太陽公轉的週期是多少?
Which planet is closest to the Sun? 哪顆行星離太陽最近?
What is the Milky Way? 銀河系是什麼?
Which planet is known as the Red Planet? 哪顆行星被稱為紅色星球?
What is the main source of energy for the solar system? 太陽系的主要能量來源是什麼?

open_ended.question: Explain why the Sun is important for life on Earth. 解釋為什麼太陽對地球上的生命很重要。
Describe one characteristic of each of the eight planets in the solar system. 描述太陽系中八顆行星各自的一個特徵。
What does the vastness of the universe tell us about our place in it? 宇宙的浩瀚告訴我們什麼關於我們在其中的位置?

true_false.statement: The Sun is the only star in the solar system. 太陽是太陽系中唯一的恆星。
All planets in the solar system have natural satellites. 太陽系中的所有行星都有天然衛星。
The Milky Way is the only galaxy in the universe. 銀河系是宇宙中唯一的星系。

themes.theme_name: Scientific Process and Spirit of Science
themes.topic_name: Science and technology create value and change human life

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that scientific discoveries can foster technological development, and technological development can also drive scientific advancement

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of how scientific discoveries foster technological development? 以下哪個是科學發現促進技術發展的例子？

options.label: A
options.text: The discovery of electricity led to the invention of light bulbs. 電的發現導致了電燈泡的發明。

options.label: B
options.text: People using smartphones to play games. 人們使用智能手機玩遊戲。

options.label: C
options.text: Watching a science documentary. 觀看科學紀錄片。

options.label: D
options.text: Drawing a picture of a robot. 畫一個機器人的圖畫。

mcq.question: How does technological development drive scientific advancement? 技術發展如何推動科學進步？

options.label: A
options.text: By providing new tools for research. 通過為研究提供新工具。

options.label: B
options.text: By making movies more exciting. 通過讓電影更精彩。

options.label: C
options.text: By increasing the number of schools. 通過增加學校數量。

options.label: D
options.text: By selling more toys. 通過銷售更多玩具。

mcq.question: Which invention was a result of scientific discoveries about germs? 以下哪項發明是關於細菌的科學發現的結果？
What role does technology play in modern medicine? 技術在現代醫學中扮演什麼角色？

options.label: A
options.text: It helps doctors diagnose diseases. 它幫助醫生診斷疾病。

options.label: B
options.text: It makes food taste better. 它讓食物更美味。

options.label: C
options.text: It designs fashionable clothes. 它設計時尚的衣服。

options.label: D
options.text: It builds taller buildings. 它建造更高的建築。

mcq.question: Which of the following is a benefit of scientific and technological advancements? 以下哪項是科學和技術進步的好處？

options.label: C
options.text: Longer school hours 更長的學校時間

options.label: D
options.text: Less playtime 更少的玩耍時間

mcq.question: How did the invention of the internet change human life? 互聯網的發明如何改變人類生活？

options.label: A
options.text: It made information sharing faster. 它使信息共享更快。

options.label: B
options.text: It made cars go faster. 它使汽車跑得更快。

options.label: C
options.text: It made food cook faster. 它使食物煮得更快。

options.label: D
options.text: It made clocks tick faster. 它使時鐘走得更快。

mcq.question: What is an example of technology driving scientific research? 以下哪個是技術推動科學研究的例子？

options.label: A
options.text: Telescopes helping astronomers study stars. 望遠鏡幫助天文學家研究星星。

options.label: B
options.text: Chefs using knives to cut vegetables. 廚師用刀切蔬菜。

options.label: C
options.text: Artists painting pictures. 藝術家畫畫。

options.label: D
options.text: Musicians playing instruments. 音樂家演奏樂器。

mcq.question: Why is it important for scientists and engineers to work together? 為什麼科學家和工程師一起工作很重要？

options.label: A
options.text: To turn scientific ideas into useful products. 將科學想法轉化為有用的產品。

options.label: B
options.text: To make more money. 賺更多的錢。

options.label: C
options.text: To win competitions. 贏得比賽。

options.label: D
options.text: To travel around the world. 環遊世界。

mcq.question: Which of the following is a result of technological development in agriculture? 以下哪項是農業技術發展的結果？

options.label: A
options.text: Increased crop yields 增加的農作物產量

options.label: B
options.text: More wild animals 更多的野生動物

mcq.question: How has science and technology improved transportation? 科學和技術如何改善交通？

options.label: A
options.text: By creating faster and safer vehicles. 通過創造更快更安全的車輛。

options.label: B
options.text: By making roads dirtier. 通過使道路更髒。

options.label: C
options.text: By reducing the number of cars. 通過減少汽車數量。

options.label: D
options.text: By stopping all traffic. 通過停止所有交通。

open_ended.question: Give one example of how a scientific discovery has changed your daily life. Explain. 舉一個科學發現如何改變你日常生活的例子並解釋。
How can technology help scientists learn more about space? 技術如何幫助科學家更多地了解太空？
Why do you think it is important for new technologies to be tested before they are used by everyone? 你認為為什麼新技術在大家使用之前需要經過測試是很重要的？

true_false.statement: Scientific discoveries and technological developments are not connected. 科學發現和技術發展沒有關聯。
The invention of the microscope helped scientists see tiny organisms. 顯微鏡的發明幫助科學家看到微小的生物。
Technology only makes life more difficult. 技術只會讓生活更困難。

themes.theme_name: Scientific Process and Spirit of Science

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise some of the scientists from the nation and Hong Kong (e.g. Tu Youyou and Charles K. Kao) and their contributions
Admire some significant figures who have contributed to the world’s scientific and technological advancements

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware of the development of some innovative technologies (e.g. artificial intelligence, big data, the Internet of Things) and their applications in the society
Recognise the impact of the development of innovative technologies on human life

mcq.question: What is Artificial Intelligence (AI)? 什麼是人工智能（AI）？

options.label: A
options.text: Machines that can think and learn like humans 能像人類一樣思考和學習的機器

options.label: B
options.text: A type of robot used in factories 工廠中使用的一種機器人

options.label: C
options.text: A computer game 一種電腦遊戲

options.label: D
options.text: A new type of smartphone 一種新型智能手機

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of the Internet of Things (IoT)? 以下哪項是物聯網（IoT）的例子？

options.label: A
options.text: A smart fridge that orders food when you run out 當食物用完時會自動訂購的智能冰箱

options.label: B
options.text: A traditional light bulb 傳統燈泡

mcq.question: How does big data help businesses? 大數據如何幫助企業？

options.label: A
options.text: By analyzing large amounts of information to make better decisions 通過分析大量信息來做出更好的決策

options.label: B
options.text: By making products cheaper 通過降低產品價格

options.label: C
options.text: By replacing all workers with machines 用機器取代所有工人

options.label: D
options.text: By creating new types of food 通過創造新型食物

mcq.question: What is a common application of AI in daily life? 人工智能在日常生活中常見的應用是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Voice assistants like Siri or Alexa 像Siri或Alexa這樣的語音助手

options.label: D
options.text: A pair of shoes 一雙鞋子

mcq.question: Which technology allows devices to communicate with each other without human intervention? 哪種技術允許設備在沒有人類干預的情況下相互通信？
How has technology improved healthcare? 技術如何改善醫療保健？

options.label: A
options.text: By enabling remote consultations with doctors 通過實現與醫生的遠程諮詢

options.label: B
options.text: By making hospitals bigger 通過使醫院更大

options.label: C
options.text: By replacing all doctors with robots 用機器人取代所有醫生

options.label: D
options.text: By inventing new diseases 通過發明新的疾病

mcq.question: What is a benefit of using drones in delivery services? 在配送服務中使用無人機有什麼好處？

options.label: A

options.label: D
options.text: Less accuracy 更低的準確性

mcq.question: Which of the following is a negative impact of technology? 以下哪項是技術的負面影響？

options.label: A
options.text: Increased screen time leading to health issues 屏幕時間增加導致健康問題

mcq.question: What is an example of innovative technology in agriculture? 農業中創新技術的例子是什麼？

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

mcq.question: How can technology help the environment? 技術如何幫助環境？

options.label: A

options.label: B
