open_ended.question: Give one example of how artificial intelligence is used in your daily life. 舉一個人工智能在你日常生活中應用的例子。
How do you think technology will change schools in the future? 你認為技術將來會如何改變學校？
What is one positive and one negative impact of the Internet of Things? 物聯網的一個正面和一個負面影響是什麼？

true_false.statement: Artificial Intelligence can only be used in computers. 人工智能只能在電腦中使用。
Big data helps scientists understand weather patterns better. 大數據幫助科學家更好地理解天氣模式。
The Internet of Things requires human intervention to work. 物聯網需要人類干預才能工作。

learning_objectives.objective: Apply design cycle to design engineering models or products: Identify needs and the problem, Collect information relevant to the problem, and evaluate existing approaches, Propose more than one design solution that meet the constraints, Compare various considerations, including practicality and aesthetics, to determine the feasibility of the design solutions, Illustrate the design idea by a sketch with text, diagrams, etc., Use tools and materials to make the engineering model or product, Test and improve the engineering model or product, Communicate the solutions to the problem

mcq.question: What is the first step in the design cycle? 設計循環的第一步是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Identify needs and the problem 識別需求和問題

options.label: C
options.text: Propose design solutions 提出設計方案

options.label: D
options.text: Test the product 測試產品

mcq.question: Why is it important to collect information before designing a product? 為什麼在設計產品之前收集信息很重要？

options.label: A
options.text: To understand the problem better 更好地理解問題

options.label: B
options.text: To skip the testing phase 跳過測試階段

options.label: C
options.text: To make the product more expensive 使產品更昂貴

options.label: D
options.text: To avoid drawing sketches 避免繪製草圖

mcq.question: What should you do after proposing a design solution? 提出設計方案後應該做什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Compare various considerations 比較各種考慮因素

options.label: B
options.text: Ignore the constraints 忽略限制

options.label: C
options.text: Stop the design process 停止設計過程

options.label: D
options.text: Sell the product immediately 立即銷售產品

mcq.question: How can you illustrate your design idea? 如何展示你的設計想法？

options.label: A
options.text: By drawing a sketch with text or diagrams 通過繪製帶有文字或圖表的草圖

options.label: B
options.text: By writing a long essay 通過寫一篇長文

options.label: C
options.text: By singing a song 通過唱歌

options.label: D
options.text: By ignoring the idea 忽略這個想法

mcq.question: What is the purpose of testing an engineering model? 測試工程模型的目的是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: To find and fix problems 發現並解決問題

options.label: B
options.text: To make it look pretty 讓它看起來漂亮

options.label: C
options.text: To hide its flaws 隱藏它的缺陷

options.label: D
options.text: To avoid using materials 避免使用材料

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a part of the design cycle? 以下哪一項不是設計循環的一部分？

options.label: A
options.text: Ignoring the problem 忽略問題

options.label: C
options.text: Proposing design solutions 提出設計方案

options.label: D
options.text: Testing the product 測試產品

mcq.question: Why is it important to compare different design solutions? 為什麼比較不同的設計方案很重要？

options.label: A
options.text: To determine the best solution 確定最佳方案

options.label: B
options.text: To make the process longer 使過程更長

options.label: C
options.text: To confuse the team 混淆團隊

options.label: D
options.text: To avoid making a decision 避免做出決定

mcq.question: What tools might you use to make an engineering model? 你可能使用什麼工具來製作工程模型？

options.label: A
options.text: Rulers, scissors, and glue 尺子、剪刀和膠水

options.label: B
options.text: A computer game 電腦遊戲

options.label: C
options.text: A cooking recipe 烹飪食譜

mcq.question: What should you do after testing your engineering model? 測試工程模型後應該做什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Improve the model based on the results 根據結果改進模型

options.label: C
options.text: Ignore the test results 忽略測試結果

options.label: D
options.text: Sell it immediately 立即銷售

mcq.question: Why is communication important in the design cycle? 為什麼在設計循環中溝通很重要？

options.label: A
options.text: To share ideas and solutions with others 與他人分享想法和解決方案

options.label: B
options.text: To keep secrets 保守秘密

options.label: C
options.text: To avoid teamwork 避免團隊合作

options.label: D
options.text: To make the process longer 使過程更長

open_ended.question: Describe one problem you might face when designing a product and how you would solve it. 描述你在設計產品時可能遇到的一個問題以及你會如何解決它。
Explain why it is important to consider both practicality and aesthetics in a design. 解釋為什麼在設計中考慮實用性和美觀性很重要。
How would you test an engineering model to make sure it works well? 你會如何測試一個工程模型以確保它運作良好？

true_false.statement: The first step in the design cycle is to propose a design solution. 設計循環的第一步是提出設計方案。
Testing an engineering model helps to find and fix problems. 測試工程模型有助於發現並解決問題。
It is not necessary to communicate your design solutions to others. 沒有必要將你的設計方案與他人溝通。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise simple first-aid for handling minor injuries or discomforts
Recognise ways to handle household accidents (e.g. fire, leakage of electricity, gas leak)
Be aware of the adverse effects of smoking, alcoholism, drug abuse and drug use on the body

mcq.question: What is the first thing you should do if you get a minor cut? 如果你有一個小傷口，你應該首先做什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Wash the wound with clean water 用清水清洗傷口

options.label: B
options.text: Apply a bandage immediately 立即貼上繃帶

options.label: C
options.text: Ignore it and let it heal on its own 忽略它，讓它自行癒合

options.label: D
options.text: Put ice directly on the wound 直接將冰塊放在傷口上

mcq.question: What should you do if you smell a gas leak at home? 如果你在家聞到煤氣洩漏，你應該怎麼做？

options.label: A
options.text: Open all windows and doors 打開所有門窗

options.label: B
options.text: Light a match to check the source 點燃火柴檢查來源

options.label: C
options.text: Turn on electrical appliances 打開電器

options.label: D
options.text: Spray water to dilute the gas 噴水稀釋煤氣

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a healthy lifestyle choice? 以下哪一項不是健康的生活方式選擇？

options.label: A
options.text: Eating a balanced diet 均衡飲食

options.label: D
options.text: Getting enough sleep 獲得足夠的睡眠

mcq.question: What is the best way to treat a minor burn? 治療輕微燒傷的最佳方法是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Run cool water over the burn 用冷水沖洗燒傷處

options.label: B
options.text: Apply butter to the burn 在燒傷處塗抹黃油

options.label: C
options.text: Pop any blisters that form 戳破形成的水泡

options.label: D
options.text: Cover the burn with a tight bandage 用緊繃帶包紮燒傷處

mcq.question: What should you do if there is a small fire in the kitchen? 如果廚房發生小火災，你應該怎麼做？

options.label: A
options.text: Use a fire extinguisher or cover the fire with a lid 使用滅火器或用蓋子蓋住火源

options.label: B
options.text: Pour water on the fire 往火上倒水

options.label: C
options.text: Run away and call for help 逃跑並呼救

options.label: D
options.text: Ignore it and let it burn out 忽略它，讓它自行熄滅

mcq.question: Which of the following is an adverse effect of smoking? 以下哪一項是吸煙的不良影響？

options.label: B
options.text: Stronger immune system 更強的免疫系統

options.label: C
options.text: Better sense of smell 更好的嗅覺

mcq.question: What should you do if someone is choking? 如果有人窒息，你應該怎麼做？

options.label: A
options.text: Perform the Heimlich maneuver 進行哈姆立克急救法

options.label: B
options.text: Give them water to drink 給他們喝水

options.label: C
options.text: Pat them on the back gently 輕輕拍他們的背

options.label: D
options.text: Tell them to cough harder 告訴他們用力咳嗽

mcq.question: Which of the following is a symptom of alcohol abuse? 以下哪一項是酗酒的症狀？

options.label: C
options.text: Better coordination 更好的協調性

options.label: D
options.text: Increased energy levels 能量水平提高

mcq.question: What is the first step in treating a nosebleed? 治療鼻血的第一步是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Pinch the nose and lean forward 捏住鼻子並向前傾

options.label: B
options.text: Lie down and tilt the head back 躺下並向後仰頭

options.label: C
options.text: Blow the nose forcefully 用力擤鼻子

options.label: D
options.text: Apply ice to the forehead 在前額敷冰

mcq.question: Which of the following is a way to prevent drug abuse? 以下哪一項是預防藥物濫用的方法？

options.label: A
options.text: Educating about the dangers of drugs 教育有關藥物的危險性

options.label: B
options.text: Trying drugs once to see their effects 嘗試藥物一次以了解其效果

options.label: C
options.text: Keeping drugs at home for emergencies 在家中存放藥物以備不時之需

options.label: D
options.text: Ignoring the topic of drugs 忽略藥物話題

open_ended.question: Describe two ways to prevent household accidents. 描述兩種預防家庭事故的方法。
Explain why smoking is harmful to the body. 解釋為什麼吸煙對身體有害。
What are three healthy habits you can practice daily? 你可以每天實踐的三個健康習慣是什麼？

true_false.statement: Smoking can cause lung cancer. 吸煙會導致肺癌。
It is safe to use water to put out an electrical fire. 用水撲滅電器火災是安全的。
Regular exercise is part of a healthy lifestyle. 定期運動是健康生活方式的一部分。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the major parts of the human circulatory system (heart, blood vessels) and their functions
Recognise the major parts of the human urinary system (kidneys, ureters, urinary bladder, urethra) and their functions
Recognise the major parts of the human nervous system (sensory organs, brain, spinal cord) and their functions
Give some examples of reflex actions (e.g. blinking when wind blows into eyes, withdrawal reflex in response to heat)

mcq.question: Which organ pumps blood throughout the body? 哪個器官負責將血液泵送到全身?
What is the function of blood vessels? 血管的功能是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To carry blood to and from the heart 將血液輸送到心臟和從心臟輸出

options.label: B
options.text: To filter waste from the blood 過濾血液中的廢物

options.label: C
options.text: To produce hormones 產生激素

options.label: D
options.text: To store oxygen 儲存氧氣

mcq.question: Which part of the urinary system stores urine? 泌尿系統的哪個部分儲存尿液?
What is the main function of the kidneys? 腎臟的主要功能是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To filter waste from the blood 過濾血液中的廢物

options.label: B
options.text: To pump blood 泵送血液

options.label: C
options.text: To produce urine 產生尿液

options.label: D
options.text: To store oxygen 儲存氧氣

mcq.question: Which part of the nervous system controls reflex actions? 神經系統的哪個部分控制反射動作?
What is an example of a reflex action? 以下哪個是反射動作的例子?

options.label: A
options.text: Blinking when wind blows into eyes 當風吹進眼睛時眨眼

options.label: B
options.text: Walking to school 走路去學校

options.label: D
options.text: Reading a book 閱讀書籍

mcq.question: Which organ is part of both the circulatory and urinary systems? 哪個器官同時屬於循環系統和泌尿系統?
What is the function of the spinal cord? 脊髓的功能是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To transmit messages between the brain and the body 在大腦和身體之間傳遞訊息

options.label: B
options.text: To pump blood 泵送血液

options.label: C
options.text: To filter waste 過濾廢物

options.label: D
options.text: To produce hormones 產生激素

mcq.question: Which part of the urinary system carries urine from the kidneys to the bladder? 泌尿系統的哪個部分將尿液從腎臟輸送到膀胱?
What is the role of sensory organs in the nervous system? 感覺器官在神經系統中的作用是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To detect changes in the environment 檢測環境中的變化

options.label: B
options.text: To pump blood 泵送血液

options.label: C
options.text: To filter waste 過濾廢物

options.label: D
options.text: To store oxygen 儲存氧氣

open_ended.question: Describe the path of blood through the circulatory system. 描述血液在循環系統中的路徑。
Explain how the urinary system removes waste from the body. 解釋泌尿系統如何從身體中移除廢物。
Give two examples of reflex actions and explain why they are important. 舉出兩個反射動作的例子並解釋它們為什麼重要。

true_false.statement: The heart is part of the circulatory system. 心臟是循環系統的一部分。
The brain is not part of the nervous system. 大腦不是神經系統的一部分。
Reflex actions are controlled by the brain. 反射動作由大腦控制。

themes.theme_name: Inter-relationship between Living Things and the Natural Environment
themes.topic_name: Impact of human behavior on the natural environment

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise some endangered species
Explain why endangered species are on the verge of extinction
Recognise some methods of protecting endangered species
Respect and care for life, and show concern for endangered species

mcq.question: Which of the following is an endangered species? 以下哪一種是瀕危物種?
What is the main reason for the extinction of many species? 許多物種滅絕的主要原因是什麼?

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: Which human activity contributes most to habitat destruction? 哪種人類活動對棲息地破壞的影響最大?
How can we protect endangered species? 我們如何保護瀕危物種?

options.label: A
options.text: By creating protected areas 建立保護區

options.label: B
options.text: By hunting them 獵殺牠們

options.label: C
options.text: By ignoring them 忽略牠們

options.label: D
options.text: By keeping them as pets 將牠們當作寵物

mcq.question: Which of the following is a method to conserve endangered species? 以下哪一種是保護瀕危物種的方法?

options.label: D
options.text: Cutting down trees 砍伐樹木

mcq.question: Why are pandas endangered? 為什麼熊貓瀕臨滅絕?

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of habitat 棲息地喪失

options.label: B
options.text: Too many predators 太多捕食者

options.label: C
options.text: They don't reproduce 牠們不繁殖

options.label: D
options.text: They are too big 牠們太大

mcq.question: What can students do to help protect endangered species? 學生可以做什麼來幫助保護瀕危物種?

options.label: A
options.text: Learn about them 學習有關牠們的知識

options.label: C
options.text: Support conservation efforts 支持保護工作

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: Which organization helps protect endangered species? 哪個組織幫助保護瀕危物種?

options.label: C
options.text: UNICEF 聯合國兒童基金會

mcq.question: What is the biggest threat to marine species? 對海洋物種最大的威脅是什麼?

options.label: B
options.text: Too much sunlight 太多陽光

mcq.question: Why is biodiversity important? 為什麼生物多樣性很重要?

options.label: A
options.text: It keeps ecosystems balanced 它保持生態系統平衡

options.label: B
options.text: It makes the planet look pretty 它讓地球看起來漂亮

options.label: C
options.text: It is not important 它不重要

options.label: D
options.text: It helps humans only 它只幫助人類

open_ended.question: Name three endangered species and explain why they are endangered. 列出三種瀕危物種並解釋牠們為什麼瀕危。
What are some ways humans can reduce their impact on the environment? 人類可以通過哪些方式減少對環境的影響?
Why should we care about endangered species? 為什麼我們應該關心瀕危物種?

true_false.statement: All endangered species are large animals. 所有瀕危物種都是大型動物。
Planting trees can help protect endangered species. 植樹可以幫助保護瀕危物種。
Pollution has no effect on endangered species. 污染對瀕危物種沒有影響。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that photosynthesis is the process by which plants produce food
Be aware of the conditions necessary for photosynthesis in plants (sunlight, water, carbon dioxide, chlorophyll)
State the importance of photosynthesis in plants to other living things

mcq.question: What is the process by which plants produce food called? 植物製造食物的過程叫什麼?
Which of the following is NOT necessary for photosynthesis? 以下哪一項不是光合作用所需的條件?
What is the green pigment in plants that absorbs sunlight called? 植物中吸收陽光的綠色色素叫什麼?
Which gas do plants take in for photosynthesis? 植物在光合作用中吸收哪種氣體?
What do plants release as a by-product of photosynthesis? 植物在光合作用中釋放什麼副產品?
Which of the following organisms is a producer in the food chain? 以下哪一種生物是食物鏈中的生產者?
What is the main source of energy for photosynthesis? 光合作用的主要能量來源是什麼?
Which of the following is a consumer in the food chain? 以下哪一種生物是食物鏈中的消費者?
Why is photosynthesis important to other living things? 為什麼光合作用對其他生物很重要?

options.label: A
options.text: It produces oxygen and food 它產生氧氣和食物

options.label: B
options.text: It produces carbon dioxide 它產生二氧化碳

options.label: C
options.text: It produces water 它產生水

options.label: D
options.text: It produces nitrogen 它產生氮氣

mcq.question: What would happen if plants stopped performing photosynthesis? 如果植物停止進行光合作用會發生什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Animals would have no food and oxygen 動物將沒有食物和氧氣

options.label: B
options.text: Animals would have more food 動物將有更多食物

options.label: C
options.text: Nothing would change 什麼都不會改變

options.label: D
options.text: Plants would grow faster 植物會長得更快

open_ended.question: Explain why plants are called producers in the food chain. 解釋為什麼植物被稱為食物鏈中的生產者。
Describe the conditions necessary for photosynthesis to occur. 描述光合作用發生所需的條件。
How does photosynthesis benefit animals and humans? 光合作用如何使動物和人類受益?

true_false.statement: Plants do not need sunlight to perform photosynthesis. 植物不需要陽光來進行光合作用。
Photosynthesis produces oxygen as a by-product. 光合作用產生氧氣作為副產品。
Animals can perform photosynthesis just like plants. 動物可以像植物一樣進行光合作用。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that cells are the basic units of living things
Use a microscope to observe animal cells and plant cells

Identify the different parts of animal and plant cells, and compare the similarities and differences between animal and plant cells (plant cells have cell walls while animal cells do not, most plant cells have chloroplasts while most animal cells do not)

mcq.question: What is the basic unit of living things? 生物的基本單位是什麼?
Which part of the plant cell is responsible for photosynthesis? 植物細胞的哪個部分負責光合作用?
What is the main difference between plant and animal cells? 植物細胞和動物細胞的主要區別是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Plant cells have a cell wall 植物細胞有細胞壁

options.label: B
options.text: Animal cells have chloroplasts 動物細胞有葉綠體

options.label: C
options.text: Plant cells do not have a nucleus 植物細胞沒有細胞核

options.label: D
options.text: Animal cells have a cell wall 動物細胞有細胞壁

mcq.question: Which instrument is used to observe cells? 觀察細胞需要使用什麼儀器?
Which of the following is NOT found in animal cells? 以下哪一項不存在於動物細胞中?
What is the function of the cell membrane? 細胞膜的功能是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To control what enters and leaves the cell 控制物質進出細胞

options.label: B
options.text: To provide structure and support 提供結構和支持

options.label: C
options.text: To produce energy 產生能量

options.label: D
options.text: To store genetic information 儲存遺傳信息

mcq.question: Which part of the cell contains genetic material? 細胞的哪一部分含有遺傳物質?
What is the function of the vacuole in plant cells? 植物細胞中液泡的功能是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To store water and nutrients 儲存水分和營養

options.label: B
options.text: To produce energy 產生能量

options.label: C
options.text: To control cell activities 控制細胞活動

options.label: D
options.text: To protect the cell 保護細胞

mcq.question: Which of the following is a similarity between plant and animal cells? 以下哪一項是植物和動物細胞的相似之處?

options.label: A
options.text: Both have chloroplasts 兩者都有葉綠體

options.label: B
options.text: Both have a cell wall 兩者都有細胞壁

options.label: C
options.text: Both have a nucleus 兩者都有細胞核

options.label: D
options.text: Both have a large central vacuole 兩者都有大液泡

mcq.question: What is the function of the mitochondria? 粒線體的功能是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To produce energy 產生能量

options.label: B
options.text: To store water 儲存水分

options.label: C
options.text: To control cell activities 控制細胞活動

options.label: D
options.text: To provide structure 提供結構

open_ended.question: Describe two differences between plant and animal cells. 描述植物細胞和動物細胞的兩個不同之處。
Explain why plant cells have chloroplasts but animal cells do not. 解釋為什麼植物細胞有葉綠體而動物細胞沒有。
What are the steps to properly use a microscope to observe cells? 正確使用顯微鏡觀察細胞的步驟是什麼?

true_false.statement: All living things are made up of cells. 所有生物都是由細胞組成的。
Animal cells have a cell wall. 動物細胞有細胞壁。
Chloroplasts are found in both plant and animal cells. 葉綠體存在於植物和動物細胞中。

learning_objectives.objective: Using water as an example, state that buoyancy is an upward force exerted by water on objects
Recognise the phenomenon of floating and sinking of objects in water

mcq.question: What is buoyancy? 什麼是浮力?

options.label: A
options.text: An upward force exerted by water on objects 水對物體施加的向上力

options.label: B
options.text: A downward force exerted by water on objects 水對物體施加的向下力

options.label: C
options.text: A sideways force exerted by water on objects 水對物體施加的側向力

options.label: D
options.text: No force exerted by water on objects 水對物體沒有施加任何力

mcq.question: Which of the following objects will float in water? 以下哪個物體會在水中浮起?

options.label: B
options.text: A metal coin 金屬硬幣

options.label: D
options.text: A glass marble 玻璃彈珠

mcq.question: What causes an object to sink in water? 什麼原因導致物體在水中下沉?

options.label: A
options.text: The object's weight is greater than the buoyant force 物體的重量大於浮力

options.label: B
options.text: The object's weight is less than the buoyant force 物體的重量小於浮力

options.label: C
options.text: The object's weight is equal to the buoyant force 物體的重量等於浮力

options.label: D
options.text: The object has no weight 物體沒有重量

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of buoyancy? 以下哪個是浮力的例子?

options.label: A
options.text: A boat floating on water 船浮在水面上

options.label: B
options.text: A rock sinking to the bottom of a lake 石頭沉到湖底

options.label: C
options.text: A balloon floating in the air 氣球飄在空中

options.label: D
options.text: A book lying on a table 書本放在桌子上

mcq.question: What happens to the buoyant force if the volume of water displaced by an object increases? 如果物體排開的水量增加，浮力會發生什麼變化?

options.label: A
options.text: The buoyant force increases 浮力增加

options.label: B
options.text: The buoyant force decreases 浮力減少

options.label: C
options.text: The buoyant force stays the same 浮力保持不變

options.label: D
options.text: The buoyant force disappears 浮力消失

mcq.question: Which of the following materials is most likely to float in water? 以下哪種材料最有可能在水中浮起?
Why does a heavy ship float on water? 為什麼沉重的船能浮在水面上?

options.label: A
options.text: It displaces enough water to create a buoyant force equal to its weight 它排開足夠的水以產生與其重量相等的浮力

options.label: B
options.text: It is made of special materials that repel water 它由排斥水的特殊材料製成

options.label: C
options.text: It has no weight 它沒有重量

options.label: D
options.text: It is filled with air, which makes it weightless 它充滿了空氣，使其沒有重量

mcq.question: What is the main factor that determines whether an object will float or sink in water? 決定物體在水中浮起或下沉的主要因素是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: The relationship between the object's weight and the buoyant force 物體重量與浮力之間的關係

options.label: B
options.text: The color of the object 物體的顏色

options.label: C
options.text: The temperature of the water 水的溫度

options.label: D
options.text: The shape of the object 物體的形狀

mcq.question: If an object floats in water, what can you say about its density compared to water? 如果一個物體在水中浮起，它的密度與水相比如何?

options.label: A
options.text: Its density is less than water 它的密度小於水

options.label: B
options.text: Its density is greater than water 它的密度大於水

options.label: C
options.text: Its density is equal to water 它的密度等於水

options.label: D
options.text: Its density is zero 它的密度為零

mcq.question: Which of the following statements about buoyancy is correct? 以下關於浮力的陳述哪個是正確的?

options.label: A
options.text: Buoyancy acts in the opposite direction to gravity 浮力的方向與重力相反

options.label: B
options.text: Buoyancy acts in the same direction as gravity 浮力的方向與重力相同

options.label: C
options.text: Buoyancy has no direction 浮力沒有方向

options.label: D
options.text: Buoyancy only acts on heavy objects 浮力只作用於重物體

open_ended.question: Explain why a small pebble sinks in water while a large ship floats. 解釋為什麼小石子會沉入水中，而大船卻能浮起。
Describe an experiment to demonstrate buoyancy using everyday materials. 描述一個使用日常材料演示浮力的實驗。
How does the shape of an object affect its ability to float in water? 物體的形狀如何影響它在水中的浮力能力?

true_false.statement: Buoyancy is an upward force exerted by water on objects. 浮力是水對物體施加的向上力。
All objects with a density greater than water will sink. 所有密度大於水的物體都會下沉。
The buoyant force depends on the color of the object. 浮力取決於物體的顏色。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware that combustion requires oxygen, and produces carbon dioxide and water
Recognise the necessary conditions for combustion, and the working principles of fire-fighting equipment (e.g. fire extinguishers, fire blankets, etc.)
Recognise the occurrence, impact and prevention of hill fires

mcq.question: What is produced during combustion? 燃燒時會產生什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Carbon dioxide and water 二氧化碳和水

options.label: B
options.text: Oxygen and nitrogen 氧氣和氮氣

options.label: C
options.text: Hydrogen and helium 氫氣和氦氣

options.label: D
options.text: Methane and ammonia 甲烷和氨氣

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a necessary condition for combustion? 以下哪一項不是燃燒的必要條件?
What does a fire blanket do? 防火毯的作用是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Cuts off oxygen supply 切斷氧氣供應

options.label: B
options.text: Cools down the fire 冷卻火源

mcq.question: Which gas is required for combustion? 燃燒需要哪種氣體?
What is the main purpose of a fire extinguisher? 滅火器的主要用途是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To start a fire 點火

options.label: B
options.text: To put out a fire 滅火

options.label: C
options.text: To measure temperature 測量溫度

options.label: D
options.text: To produce oxygen 產生氧氣

mcq.question: Which of the following can prevent hill fires? 以下哪一項可以預防山火?

options.label: A
options.text: Leaving campfires unattended 無人看管營火

options.label: B
options.text: Throwing cigarette butts in the forest 在森林中丟煙頭

options.label: C
options.text: Clearing dry leaves and debris 清理乾葉和碎屑

options.label: D
options.text: Burning trash in dry weather 在乾燥天氣焚燒垃圾

mcq.question: What is the impact of hill fires? 山火的影響是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Destroys wildlife habitats 破壞野生動物棲息地

options.label: B
options.text: Improves air quality 改善空氣質量

options.label: D
options.text: Makes soil more fertile 使土壤更肥沃

mcq.question: Which of the following is a chemical change? 以下哪一項是化學變化?
What is the main principle of fire-fighting equipment? 滅火設備的主要原理是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: To add more oxygen 增加氧氣

options.label: B
options.text: To remove one or more conditions for combustion 去除一個或多個燃燒條件

options.label: C
options.text: To increase the temperature 提高溫度

options.label: D
options.text: To produce more fuel 產生更多燃料

mcq.question: Which of the following is a physical change? 以下哪一項是物理變化?

open_ended.question: Explain why oxygen is necessary for combustion. 解釋為什麼燃燒需要氧氣。
Describe two ways to prevent hill fires. 描述兩種預防山火的方法。
What are the differences between physical and chemical changes? Give one example of each. 物理變化和化學變化有什麼區別？各舉一個例子。

true_false.statement: Combustion can occur without oxygen. 燃燒可以在沒有氧氣的情況下發生。
A fire blanket works by cutting off the oxygen supply to the fire. 防火毯通過切斷火源的氧氣供應來滅火。
Hill fires have no impact on the environment. 山火對環境沒有影響。

themes.theme_name: Forms of Energy and Energy Transfer
themes.topic_name: Properties of light and related phenomena

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the mode of light propagation
Recognise the characteristics of images formed by a plane mirror, including being the same size as the object and laterally inverted
Give daily application of different types of mirrors, including plane, convex and concave mirrors
Be aware that refraction occurs when light passes through different transparent materials
Give examples of daily applications of refraction of light (e.g. glasses, magnifying glasses, microscopes)

mcq.question: How does light travel? 光是怎樣傳播的?

options.label: A
options.text: In straight lines 以直線傳播

options.label: B
options.text: In curved lines 以曲線傳播

options.label: C
options.text: In zigzag lines 以鋸齒線傳播

options.label: D
options.text: In circular lines 以圓形線傳播

mcq.question: What is the size of the image formed by a plane mirror compared to the object? 平面鏡形成的影像與物體的大小比較是怎樣的?

options.label: A
options.text: Smaller than the object 比物體小

options.label: B
options.text: Larger than the object 比物體大

options.label: C
options.text: The same size as the object 與物體大小相同

options.label: D
options.text: Depends on the distance 視乎距離而定

mcq.question: Which type of mirror is used in a car's side mirror? 汽車的側鏡使用的是哪種鏡子?

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: What happens to light when it passes from air into water? 當光從空氣進入水中時會發生什麼現象?
Which of the following is an example of refraction of light? 以下哪個是光折射的例子?

options.label: A
options.text: Looking at a mirror 照鏡子

options.label: B
options.text: Using a magnifying glass 使用放大鏡

options.label: C
options.text: Looking at a shadow 看影子

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: What is the characteristic of an image formed by a plane mirror? 平面鏡形成的影像有什麼特徵?

options.label: A
options.text: It is upside down 它是倒轉的

options.label: B
options.text: It is laterally inverted 它是左右相反的

options.label: C
options.text: It is smaller than the object 它比物體小

options.label: D
options.text: It is larger than the object 它比物體大

mcq.question: Which mirror is used in a flashlight to focus light? 手電筒中使用哪種鏡子來聚焦光線?

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: What is the main reason we can see objects? 我們能看到物體的主要原因是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Objects emit light 物體發光

options.label: B
options.text: Light reflects off objects 光從物體反射

options.label: C
options.text: Objects absorb light 物體吸收光

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a property of light? 以下哪個不是光的特性?

options.label: A
options.text: Travels in straight lines 以直線傳播

options.label: B
options.text: Can be reflected 可以被反射

options.label: C
options.text: Can be refracted 可以被折射

options.label: D
options.text: Can be heard 可以被聽到

mcq.question: What is the phenomenon called when light bends as it passes through different materials? 當光通過不同材料時彎曲的現象叫什麼?

open_ended.question: Give two examples of daily applications of convex mirrors. 舉出兩個凸面鏡在日常生活中的應用例子。
Explain why a pencil appears bent when placed in a glass of water. 解釋為什麼鉛筆放在一杯水中時看起來是彎曲的。
Describe how a plane mirror forms an image. 描述平面鏡如何形成影像。

true_false.statement: Light can travel through a vacuum. 光可以在真空中傳播。

Refraction occurs when light passes from one medium to another. 當光從一種介質進入另一種介質時會發生折射。

themes.theme_name: Forms of Energy and Energy Transfer
themes.topic_name: Properties of electricity and related phenomena

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware of the heating effect and magnetic effect of electric current
Give examples of daily applications of the heating effect (e.g. electric heaters, hairdryers, toasters) and magnetic effect (e.g. electromagnetic cranes, electromagnetic locks) of electric current

mcq.question: Which of the following devices uses the heating effect of electric current? 以下哪種設備利用了電流的熱效應?

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Due to the heating effect of electric current 由於電流的熱效應

mcq.question: What is the purpose of the electromagnet in an electromagnetic lock? 電磁鎖中的電磁鐵有什麼作用?

options.label: A
options.text: To generate heat 產生熱量

options.label: C
options.text: To create a strong magnetic force 產生強大的磁力

options.label: D
options.text: To make a sound 發出聲音

mcq.question: Which material is commonly used as a heating element in electric heaters? 電暖器中常用的加熱元件是什麼材料?

How can the strength of an electromagnet be increased? 如何增強電磁鐵的強度?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Increase the current 增加電流

options.label: C
options.text: Use an iron core 使用鐵芯

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

open_ended.question: Give two examples of devices that use the heating effect of electric current and explain how they work. 舉出兩個利用電流熱效應的設備例子，並解釋它們的工作原理。
Explain why electromagnetic cranes are useful in scrapyards. 解釋為什麼電磁起重機在廢料場很有用。
Describe one safety precaution we should take when using electrical appliances that produce heat. 描述我們在使用會產生熱的電器時應採取的一項安全預防措施。

true_false.statement: Electric current can produce both heat and magnetic effects. 電流可以同時產生熱效應和磁效應。
An electric fan uses the magnetic effect of electric current to operate. 電風扇利用電流的磁效應來運作。
Electromagnetic locks are commonly used in secure buildings. 電磁鎖常用於安全建築中。

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the applications of three types of levers (the fulcrum located in between the effort and the load, the load located in between the fulcrum and the effort, the effort located in between the fulcrum and the load)
Be aware of the difference between a lever that reduces the effort required and a lever that requires more effort
Recognise the working principles of simple machines such as pulleys (fixed pulley, movable pulley, pulley system) and gears
Give examples of daily applications of levers, pulleys and gears (e.g. chopsticks, cable cars, bicycles)

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of a first-class lever where the fulcrum is located between the effort and the load? 以下哪個是第一類槓桿的例子，其中支點位於施力和負載之間？
Which type of lever requires more effort but increases the distance moved by the load? 哪種類型的槓桿需要更多的施力，但增加了負載移動的距離？

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above 以上皆非

mcq.question: What is the main advantage of using a movable pulley? 使用動滑輪的主要優點是什麼？

options.label: B
options.text: It reduces the effort required 它減少所需的施力

options.label: C
options.text: It increases the speed of the load 它增加負載的速度

options.label: D
options.text: It makes the load heavier 它使負載更重

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of a second-class lever? 以下哪個是第二類槓桿的例子？

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The direction of the force changes 力的方向改變

options.label: D
options.text: The load becomes heavier 負載變得更重

mcq.question: Which simple machine is used in a bicycle to change the speed? 自行車中使用哪種簡單機械來改變速度？
What is the function of a fixed pulley? 固定滑輪的功能是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: To reduce the effort required 減少所需的施力

options.label: B
options.text: To change the direction of the force 改變力的方向

options.label: C
options.text: To increase the speed of the load 增加負載的速度

options.label: D
options.text: To make the load heavier 使負載更重

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of a third-class lever? 以下哪個是第三類槓桿的例子？
How do gears help in a machine? 齒輪如何在機器中有幫助？

options.label: A
options.text: They reduce friction 它們減少摩擦

options.label: B
options.text: They change the direction or speed of rotation 它們改變旋轉的方向或速度

options.text: They increase the weight of the load 它們增加負載的重量

options.label: D
options.text: They make the machine louder 它們使機器更大聲

mcq.question: Which simple machine is used in a cable car? 纜車中使用哪種簡單機械？

open_ended.question: Give two examples of first-class levers used in daily life and explain why they are first-class levers. 舉出兩個日常生活中使用的第一類槓桿的例子，並解釋為什麼它們是第一類槓桿。
Explain how a movable pulley reduces the effort required to lift a load. 解釋動滑輪如何減少提升負載所需的施力。
Describe how gears are used in a bicycle and what advantage they provide. 描述齒輪如何在自行車中使用以及它們提供的優點。

true_false.statement: A second-class lever always reduces the effort required to lift a load. 第二類槓桿總是減少提升負載所需的施力。
A fixed pulley reduces the effort required to lift a load. 固定滑輪減少提升負載所需的施力。
Chopsticks are an example of a third-class lever. 筷子是第三類槓桿的例子。

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware of the formation processes of fossils and fossil fuels
Be aware that some natural disasters (e.g. volcanic eruptions, earthquakes) are related to crustal activities
Recognise some ways that human respond to natural disasters

mcq.question: How are fossils formed? 化石是如何形成的?

options.label: A
options.text: From the remains of dead plants and animals buried under layers of sediment 來自被埋在沉積層下的動植物遺骸

options.label: B
options.text: From melted rocks deep inside the Earth 來自地球深處的熔融岩石

options.label: C
options.text: From water evaporating from the ocean 來自海洋中蒸發的水分

options.label: D
options.text: From lightning striking the ground 來自閃電擊中地面

mcq.question: Which of the following is a fossil fuel? 以下哪一種是化石燃料?
What causes earthquakes? 地震是由什麼引起的?

options.label: A
options.text: Movement of tectonic plates 板塊運動

mcq.question: Which natural disaster is caused by the eruption of magma from the Earth's crust? 哪一種自然災害是由地殼中的岩漿噴發引起的?
How can humans prepare for natural disasters? 人類如何為自然災害做準備?

options.label: A
options.text: By building earthquake-resistant structures 建造抗震建築

options.label: B
options.text: By cutting down all trees 砍伐所有樹木

options.label: C
options.text: By ignoring warning signs 忽略警告信號

options.label: D
options.text: By living near active volcanoes 住在活火山附近

mcq.question: What is the main source of energy for fossil fuels? 化石燃料的主要能量來源是什麼?

options.label: A
options.text: Ancient sunlight stored in plants and animals 儲存在動植物中的古老陽光

options.label: A
options.text: Creating early warning systems 建立早期預警系統

options.label: B
options.text: Building houses with weak foundations 建造地基不穩的房屋

options.label: C
options.text: Ignoring safety drills 忽略安全演習

options.label: D
options.text: Living in high-risk areas 住在高風險地區

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a fossil fuel? 以下哪一種不是化石燃料?

options.label: A
options.text: They provide clues about Earth's history 它們提供關於地球歷史的線索

options.label: B
options.text: They are used as fuel 它們被用作燃料

options.label: C
options.text: They are beautiful to look at 它們看起來很美

options.label: D
options.text: They are easy to find 它們很容易找到

open_ended.question: Describe one way fossils can help us understand Earth's history. 描述化石如何幫助我們了解地球歷史的一種方式。

true_false.statement: Fossil fuels are formed from the remains of ancient plants and animals. 化石燃料是由古代動植物的遺骸形成的。

themes.topic_name: Some phenomena and patterns observed on the Earth caused by the movements of the Sun, Earth and Moon

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the relative sizes, positions and movements of the Sun, Earth and Moon
Be aware of the patterns of moon phases
Be aware of the four moon phases: new moon, first quarter, full moon and third quarter
Explain the causes of solar and lunar eclipses
Be aware that tides are the rise and fall of sea levels caused by the gravitational pull of the Sun and the Moon

options.text: Sun, Earth, Moon 太陽、地球、月亮

options.label: B
options.text: Earth, Sun, Moon 地球、太陽、月亮

options.label: C
options.text: Moon, Earth, Sun 月亮、地球、太陽

options.label: D
options.text: Sun, Moon, Earth 太陽、月亮、地球

mcq.question: What causes the phases of the Moon? 什麼導致月亮的相位變化？

options.label: A
options.text: The Earth's shadow on the Moon 地球在月亮上的影子

options.label: B
options.text: The Moon's rotation around the Earth 月亮繞地球的旋轉

options.label: C
options.text: The Sun's light reflecting off the Moon 太陽光從月亮上反射

options.label: B
options.text: The Earth passing between the Sun and the Moon 地球經過太陽和月亮之間

options.label: C
options.text: The Sun blocking the Moon 太陽遮擋月亮

options.label: D
options.text: The Moon blocking the Earth 月亮遮擋地球

mcq.question: What causes a lunar eclipse? 什麼導致月食？

options.label: A
options.text: The Moon passing between the Earth and the Sun 月亮經過地球和太陽之間

options.label: B
options.text: The Earth passing between the Sun and the Moon 地球經過太陽和月亮之間

options.label: C
options.text: The Sun blocking the Moon 太陽遮擋月亮

options.label: D
options.text: The Moon blocking the Earth 月亮遮擋地球

options.label: B
options.text: The gravitational pull of the Sun and the Moon 太陽和月亮的引力

options.label: C
options.text: The Earth's orbit around the Sun 地球繞太陽的軌道

options.label: D
options.text: The Moon's orbit around the Earth 月亮繞地球的軌道

options.label: D
options.text: The Moon rotates faster than it orbits the Earth 月亮的自轉速度比繞地球公轉速度快

mcq.question: What is the primary source of the Moon's light? 月亮的光主要來自哪裡？

options.label: A
options.text: The Moon produces its own light 月亮自己發光

options.label: B
options.text: The Sun's light reflecting off the Moon 太陽光從月亮上反射

options.label: C
options.text: The Earth's light reflecting off the Moon 地球光從月亮上反射

options.label: D
options.text: Stars' light reflecting off the Moon 星光從月亮上反射

open_ended.question: Explain why we always see the same side of the Moon from Earth. 解釋為什麼我們從地球總是看到月亮的同一面。
Describe the difference between a solar eclipse and a lunar eclipse. 描述日食和月食的區別。
How do the gravitational pulls of the Sun and the Moon affect the tides on Earth? 太陽和月亮的引力如何影響地球上的潮汐？

true_false.statement: The Moon is larger than the Earth. 月亮比地球大。
A full moon occurs when the Moon is on the opposite side of the Earth from the Sun. 滿月發生在月亮位於地球與太陽的相反方向時。
Tides only occur once a day. 潮汐每天只發生一次。

themes.theme_name: Scientific Process and Spirit of Science
themes.topic_name: Science and technology create value and change human life

learning_objectives.objective: Recognise the balance between scientific and technological development and ethics
Be aware of the limitations of scientific knowledge

mcq.question: What should scientists consider when developing new technology? 科學家在開發新技術時應該考慮什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Only the benefits of the technology 只考慮技術的好處

options.label: B
options.text: The balance between benefits and ethical concerns 技術的好處與倫理問題之間的平衡

options.label: C
options.text: The cost of the technology 技術的成本

options.label: D
options.text: The popularity of the technology 技術的普及程度

mcq.question: Which of the following is an example of how science and technology have changed human life? 以下哪個是科學和技術改變人類生活的例子？

options.label: B
options.text: The discovery of fire 火的發現

options.label: C
options.text: The development of smartphones 智能手機的發展

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: Why is it important to recognize the limitations of scientific knowledge? 為什麼認識科學知識的局限性很重要？

options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: How can technology help protect the environment? 技術如何幫助保護環境？

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: By increasing energy efficiency 通過提高能源效率

options.label: C
options.text: By developing renewable energy sources 通過開發可再生能源

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: What is a limitation of scientific knowledge? 科學知識的局限性是什麼？

options.label: B
options.text: It can answer all questions 它可以回答所有問題

options.label: B
options.text: Discovering new planets 發現新行星

options.label: C
options.text: Building taller buildings 建造更高的建築物

options.label: D
options.text: Inventing new toys 發明新玩具

mcq.question: How has the internet changed human life? 互聯網如何改變人類生活？

options.label: A
options.text: By making communication faster 通過使溝通更快

options.label: B
options.text: By providing access to information 通過提供信息訪問

options.label: C
options.text: By enabling online shopping 通過實現網上購物

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: Why is it important to question scientific findings? 為什麼質疑科學發現很重要？

options.label: B
options.text: To encourage critical thinking 鼓勵批判性思維

options.label: C
options.text: To improve scientific understanding 提高科學理解

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

open_ended.question: Give an example of how science and technology have improved healthcare. 舉一個科學和技術改善醫療保健的例子。
What are some ethical concerns related to artificial intelligence? 與人工智能相關的一些倫理問題是什麼？

true_false.statement: Scientific knowledge is always complete and never changes. 科學知識總是完整且永不改變。

themes.topic_name: The nation’s and the world’s aerospace technology development

learning_objectives.objective: Be aware of the purpose of human exploration of space
Be aware of the methods used by ancient people and modern scientists to conduct astronomical observations and space exploration
Recognise the developmental milestones of human space exploration, including artificial satellites, moon landing, the International Space Station, and manned spaceflight

Show concerns for the nation’s significant achievements in space exploration (e.g. lunar and deep space exploration) and aerospace technology (e.g. Tiangong space station, BeiDou Navigation Satellite System)
Realise the importance of aerospace technology development to the nation’s interests and security

mcq.question: What was the first artificial satellite launched into space? 第一個發射到太空的人造衛星是什麼？

options.label: C
options.text: Hubble Space Telescope 哈伯太空望遠鏡

options.label: D
options.text: International Space Station 國際太空站

options.label: D
options.text: None of the above (telescopes were invented later) 以上皆非（望遠鏡是後來發明的）

mcq.question: What is the purpose of the BeiDou Navigation Satellite System? 北斗導航衛星系統的目的是什麼？

options.label: B
options.text: Global positioning and navigation 全球定位和導航

mcq.question: Which of the following is a milestone in human space exploration? 以下哪項是人類太空探索的里程碑？

options.label: A
options.text: First artificial satellite 第一顆人造衛星

options.label: B
options.text: First human in space 第一位人類進入太空

options.label: C
options.text: First Moon landing 首次登月

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: What is the International Space Station (ISS) used for? 國際太空站（ISS）的用途是什麼？

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: Which Chinese mission successfully landed on the far side of the Moon? 哪個中國任務成功登陸月球背面？
Why is aerospace technology important for a country's security? 為什麼航空航天技術對一個國家的安全很重要？

options.label: A
options.text: It helps in weather forecasting 它有助於天氣預報

options.label: B
options.text: It enables satellite navigation 它使衛星導航成為可能

options.label: C
options.text: It supports communication and defense systems 它支持通訊和防禦系統

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above 以上皆是

mcq.question: What did ancient people use to observe the stars before telescopes were invented? 在望遠鏡發明之前，古代人用什麼來觀察星星？

options.label: B
options.text: Naked eyes and simple tools 肉眼和簡單工具

open_ended.question: What are two purposes of human space exploration? 人類太空探索的兩個目的是什麼？
Describe one significant achievement of China in space exploration. 描述中國在太空探索中的一項重大成就。
Why is the International Space Station important for scientific research? 為什麼國際太空站對科學研究很重要？

true_false.statement: The first human to travel to space was from the United States. 第一位進入太空的人來自美國。
The Tiangong space station is a project by China. 天宮太空站是中國的項目。
Ancient people used telescopes to observe the stars. 古代人使用望遠鏡觀察星星。

learning_objectives.objective: Apply design cycle to design engineering models or products: Identify needs and the problem, Collect information relevant to the problem, and point out the shortcomings of the existing practices, Propose more than one design solution that meet the constraints, Compare various considerations, take into account practicality and aesthetics, to determine the feasibility of the design solutions, Give suggestions to others’ design solutions, Illustrate design ideas through comprehensive use of text, icons, images, diagrams, etc., Select and use appropriate tools and materials to make the engineering model or product, Test and improve the engineering model or product, Communicate the solutions to the problem, review and evaluate the effectiveness of the solutions

mcq.question: What is the first step in the design cycle? 設計循環的第一步是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Identify needs and the problem 確定需求和問題

options.label: C
options.text: Propose design solutions 提出設計方案

options.label: D
options.text: Test the product 測試產品

mcq.question: Why is it important to collect information relevant to the problem? 為什麼收集與問題相關的信息很重要？

options.label: A
options.text: To make the problem more complicated 使問題更複雜

options.label: B
options.text: To understand the problem better 更好地理解問題

options.label: C
options.text: To skip the design cycle 跳過設計循環

options.label: D
options.text: To avoid testing the product 避免測試產品

mcq.question: What should you do after proposing design solutions? 提出設計方案後應該做什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Ignore the solutions 忽略方案

options.label: B
options.text: Compare various considerations 比較各種考慮因素

options.label: C
options.text: Stop the design process 停止設計過程

mcq.question: Which of the following is NOT a part of the design cycle? 以下哪項不是設計循環的一部分？

options.label: B
options.text: Testing the product 測試產品

options.label: D
options.text: Communicating solutions 溝通解決方案

mcq.question: What is the purpose of testing the engineering model? 測試工程模型的目的是什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: To find and fix problems 發現並解決問題

options.label: B
options.text: To make the model look pretty 讓模型看起來漂亮

options.label: C
options.text: To skip the design cycle 跳過設計循環

options.label: D
options.text: To ignore feedback 忽略反饋

mcq.question: Which tool is most appropriate for creating a detailed diagram of a design? 哪種工具最適合用於創建設計的詳細圖表？

options.label: B
options.text: A ruler and pencil 尺和鉛筆

options.label: D
options.text: A pair of scissors 剪刀

mcq.question: Why is it important to consider practicality in a design? 為什麼在設計中考慮實用性很重要？

options.label: A
options.text: To make the design unusable 使設計無法使用

options.label: B
options.text: To ensure the design works in real life 確保設計在現實生活中可行

options.label: C
options.text: To ignore user needs 忽略用戶需求

options.label: D
options.text: To make the design more expensive 使設計更昂貴

mcq.question: What should you do after testing the engineering model? 測試工程模型後應該做什麼？

options.label: A
options.text: Ignore the results 忽略結果

options.label: B
options.text: Improve the model 改進模型

options.label: C
options.text: Stop the design process 停止設計過程

options.label: D
options.text: Throw away the model 扔掉模型

mcq.question: Which of the following is a way to illustrate design ideas? 以下哪種方法是說明設計想法的方式？

options.label: A
options.text: Using only text 僅使用文字

options.label: B
options.text: Using text, icons, images, and diagrams 使用文字、圖標、圖像和圖表

options.label: C
options.text: Ignoring visuals 忽略視覺元素

options.label: D
options.text: Using only colors 僅使用顏色

mcq.question: What is the final step in the design cycle? 設計循環的最後一步是什麼？

options.label: B
options.text: Communicate the solutions 溝通解決方案

open_ended.question: Describe one problem you might encounter when designing a bridge and how you would solve it. 描述你在設計橋樑時可能遇到的一個問題以及你會如何解決它。
Explain why it is important to consider aesthetics in a design. 解釋為什麼在設計中考慮美學很重要。
How would you test a model of a new toy to ensure it is safe for children? 你會如何測試一個新玩具的模型以確保它對兒童是安全的？

true_false.statement: The design cycle is a linear process with no repeating steps. 設計循環是一個沒有重複步驟的線性過程。
Collecting information helps in understanding the problem better. 收集信息有助於更好地理解問題。
Testing the product is not necessary if the design looks good. 如果設計看起來很好，就不需要測試產品。
